comments: Lois was so acommodating and she was very warm and welcoming. Her location is great the space is truly magical and the energy is relaxing. I highly recommend this space.
The condo was great. It was very clean and a great location. It was a 15 min walk to town lake. Will definitely recommend to friends and stay there again!

Sylvia is an absolutely amazing host!  The location is absolutely perfect!  I couldn't think of a better place to stay if I were coming for SXSW.  You get a beautiful place with a bathroom and kitchen.  She's also one of the nicest people I've met in Austin and that's saying something!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: I had  lovely time staying in the loft. It's very open clean and airy. The airTunes was a plus and there's a fantastic coffee shop  downstairs with a killer latte. Frederick was extremely accommodating and brought us some great coffee beans. Would definitely stay here when in Austin next!
I was new to airbnb and was very happy with my stay.  it was nice meeting elizabeth she was very easy to talk to and I felt very comfortable staying in her home.
I loooved the place.  Very neat super comfortable great location and everything available for a feeling of home away from home.  Thank you Sylvia I have already told some of my friends.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: The place was in a great location it had everything we needed we had a reserved parking and it was very clean Angele offered us help with anything we needed. If I needed again a rental in Austin it definitely would be here. The neighborhood was great to take walks and everybody around was so friendly.

My son and I had a wonderful stay at Elizabeths home. She and David were great with helping me. I lost my map and David met me to guide us to the home. Their home is easy access off the interstate. My son really enjoyed meeting Jake.

Nancy & Jamey Bond

The house was clean spacious and easy to find. Had the weather been better I would have taken advantage of the back patio. The only drawback was the 20 minute drive on Austin's serpentine collection of highways but not necessarily a drawback unless you stat during the week when you have to contend with rush hour.

I stayed here January 9 to January 15 and unfortunately Austin was in the 30s and 40s temperature wise; the heater in the apartment works great!  The rental is in a great location.  For people without rental cars it's on a direct bus line to Whole Foods (I walked there but it's about a 10 minute walk and there are hills) UT-Austin and downtown.

Angele is a great host and she responded to my questions quickly while I was in Austin.

Elizabeth and David are wonderful hosts. They went out of the way to make us feel at home including sharing their seafood dinner with us. Yum! We stayed at their South Austin house for a couple of weeks and had a great time. Thanks!
Great place close to everything you would want to see in Austin. Sylvia was kind and helpful.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: A nice little apartment clean and tidy. Pluses are the interesting neighborhood and congeniality of the hosts. No real complaints except lack of heat during an unusually cold January which Drew remedied with a brand new heater. Watch out though for the tiles at the bottom of the stairs - they are slippy when wet! A very nice place for a short stay.

Thank you so much Sylvia! Your studio was the perfect place for us to relax after the photography convention in San Antonio.  I just wished we could have stayed longer.  Wonderful to have met you and we will be back the next time we are in Austin!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments:
Imagine a home perfect in every way for a place right around the corner from downtown Austin and this describes Sovay`s home. 

Sovay's place was exactly as she described. It's in a great location and is an absolute bargain for staying in such a convenient spot. It was clean neat and comfortable. She was a pleasure to deal with and she really made me feel home.

I had my absolute privacy.  Bathroom was private and right next to my bedroom.  There was an LCD TV on the wall in the bedroom but I preferred surfing online on my notebook in the living room.  Cappuccino maker as well as some other small kitchen appliances are brand new for guests service.  If you prefer having your coffee outside you have many options at Sovay`s wonderful suggestions.

It was a great experience being a guest her home you might want to have-

Drew and Simone are absolutely wonderful hosts! My boyfriend and I enjoyed our stay with them so much that we had to add on an extra day :) 
The flat was the perfect size extremely clean and included everything we needed.

Had a brilliant stay at this fun little place!  It was perfect for my needs - a place to sleep and a calm place to relax in after a very stressful day in Austin.  Lois was helpful and a lovely hostess.  Between the artwork around the property the the plethora of pillows and blankets and the calmly energetic vibe of the place I would definitely recommend this little gem.  

Thanks to its proximity to S. Lamar there are tons of things to do in the area and everything felt close by.  I know I will definitely try to stay there again the next time I'm in town.

This was my first experience with airbnb and I will without a doubt be using this service again thanks in no small part to Elizabeth. She made my stay incredibly easy and comfortable and I highly suggest to anyone coming to the Austin area to stay with these great people. Thanks again Elizabeth!

Staying at Drew's flat was our first airbnb experience and it could not have gone better.We were greeted by Drew and his whole family we even got to meet their feathered friends one of whom had recently laid her first egg! The apt was top notch so clean and comfortable. It  actually was even nicer than the photo's let on! Really loved the decor and the semi circle shower stand was awesome so modern I was secretly stealing design ideas! We were very impressed with the flat and plan to stay here again. Thank you Drew and family for being so warm and welcoming.
sovay was great. very kind and attentive. the room is perfect for one but was a bit small for two.  the bed flat screen location access to kitchen and laundry were all excellent.

Sovay was a wonderful hostess! She was very accommodating had great recommendations and her home was warm and inviting. I felt right at home. The location is also perfect for checking out Austin- very close to great restaurants yoga studios cafes shopping. I'll definitely be back!

Location was great! Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance. The loft was spacious and decorated. One dislike about the loft was that it seemed like the host had recently stayed there. 
Fred was very accomodating to our travel plans and left precious instructions and recommendations!

Drew and Simone were excellent hosts. Everything was all set for us upon arrival the apartment was clean and we felt very comfortable there. The entrance to the apartment is in the backyard up a set of stairs over the garage and separate from the house.  We felt free to come and go without worrying about disrupting their household.  The chickens and dogs were often hanging out in the yard and always fun to see as we headed out for the day.

We experienced Austin during the absolute freakiest cold spell with below-freezing temperatures snow ice and strong winds.  Our hosts provided a space heater that was portable and efficient with circulating and warming the air in the aparment.  Its good that it is lightweight and portable because we did move it between the main room to the bath room as needed to keep things at a cozy temperature.  I think that most people will not experience this situation since we were there in a "worst-case" scenario regarding the weather.

There is a nice flat-screen tv with netflix and pandora but otherwise no channels.  This was preferable to us and we used the netflix quite a bit.  Wifi was also provided and quite useful.

The Hyde Park location was great for us coffee shops & groceries are easy walking distance.  We were there mostly to check out the city and surrounding neighborhoods.  We spent one day walking from the apartment through Hyde Park down to the University Capitol and downtown.  So it is possible to walk all the way downtown from the apartment but it is quite a hike.  If you don't have a car it would make sense to get familiar with the bus schedule for the area or locate a bike.

We would highly recommend this apartment rental to individuals or couples that are visiting Austin and looking for a cozy clean & relaxed place to stay with fairly close access to the university and to downtown.

Lois was a great hostess and her place is a true Austin original.  The location is unbeatable and having a colorful private cottage in the Zilker neighborhood to come home to each night was wonderful.  If you need a "new austin" hipster spot with an ipod port you can rent a room on Congress for $300/night.  If you're looking for a unique experience that is more in line with the Austin that I grew up with try staying with Lois.

cheers
Michael
(Austin Native)

Angele's condo in Clarksville was amazing. The space is modern and clean. The location is the best part you can walk to have coffee or dinner and the state capital is only 1.4 miles away. Angele is a wonderful host and I highly recommend her condo.

the house was a good value. the weather was crazy cold which had nothing to do with the host but it did color our experience as the house was freezing cold and nothing seemed to help. we used a space heater and the house had electrical problems so that worked occasionally. the internet was down 5 of 6 days so it was very difficult to do business. 
hosts were responsive and helpful.

Sovay's place was everything she described it to be.
Great location nice home comfortable bed.
I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend this place 
Completely! Thanks!

Very convenient location to the Convention Center and downtown Austin.  The studio is very nice and Sylvia is a wonderful host.  I walked downtown every day and it took only about 10 minutes with waiting at traffic lights.  This is a great little place for the Spring-time temperatures.

I would have given this 4 stars except for the following which were somewhat out of the control of the owner:

My only complaints are that the stove was not hooked up nor were there any pots or pans so cooking my own meals other than microwave meals was out.  It was also abnormally cold in Austin the week I was there and the only source of heat was a nice space heater that tried its hardest to fight off the sub-freezing temperatures outside.  The studio had a hard time even maintaining 65 degrees with the heater cranked.  This also translated to the hot water in the shower which for some reason could not exceed luke warm.  Let's just say showers were exhilarating!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments:
Very comfortable and roomy. Close to downtown but not really walking distance. We had a great time. I would recommend staying here.

Two suggestions: a TV and an extra blanket.

We had a great stay at Lois's place! It's so gorgeous with all the colors and I'm absolutely in love with the Barber Mobile and the chandelier that hangs about the swing. It was absolutely perfect for what we needed. My only regret was that I never had the pleasure of meeting Lois. Our schedules (and my sleep) would not allow it.
If you're looking for a no frills but a bright and comfortable place to sleep for a night or two this is the place. Oh great location too. You could walk to one of the Alamo Draft House theaters from here.

Sylvia was great!  The place was clean and it had everything one would need for an awesome stay in Austin.  She was also very accommodating to our odd arrival and departure times.  This was my first Airbnb experience and I can tell you that staying at Sylvia's place for the night has me hooked.

Oh! I forgot to mention that she has a bad ass VHS movie collection for winding down with after a night on 6th street. =)
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: Sovay was a great host! We had a great visit in Austin her place was clean and comfortable. Great coffee too! The house is super cute has everything you need for a great alternative to a hotel. And it's close to everything great about Austin!

Angele was super easy to get a hold of and book her apartment (I needed it the next day!). I had a great time walking everywhere in Austin including to downtown every day and it was a comfortable place to stay each evening.

Everything was clean and simple and the condo itself is very attractive. Quiet neighbors/neighborhood and restful sleep every night made for a great stay. 

P.S. I found myself eating great meals and drinking tasty coffee about two blocks away on 10th ave. A great neighborhood to explore.

Very Very Nice PeopleI was Blessed to find this place we relocated and really needed a place we can afford while we looked for work & a Apt It felt like home relaxing place.I would say if you are looking for a nice place THIS IS IT! Thank you for opening your home up and sharing it with us..
I loved sitting on the back porch and meditating with Nature what peace that wasThank you again hope we stay connected..
Patrick & Toni

This cottage is clean and classy.  The wireless access was also handy.  We enjoyed visiting our daughter in Austin and this cottage gave us a nice little home away from home.  It is located in a great neighborhood with easy access to the airport and downtown.  We will go back!
Loft was nicely decorated and the host was friendly.  About 2 miles from downtown.

Very comfy bed.  Thick and soft towels...what more can you need?  Oh! WiFi.  There is that too.  Sovay was accommodating and available to help me get around Austin (I was there for a conference) and also respectful of my privacy.  I definitely felt at home in her house and comfortable leaving and returning at odd hours.  The neighborhood is great - there is a funky cafe within a few minutes walk - and downtown is about 1.5 miles away.  I also enjoyed patting her very sweet dog (separated from the guest area by an accordion gate) when I would return.

This place was absolutely adorable and added just the right amount of charm to our Austin adventure.  Lois was delightful.  A world of help and knowledge about her most loved city!  You coudn't ask for a better host!!

Trusting thoughtful and generous hostess. If your looking for a peaceful place to cycle through your emotions the location couldn't be more perfect. Best moments: 'the late nite search for the ultimate rainforest noise machine'  'big dreams a little backyard cottage and cot bed to rest my head'  'sharing pasta! and slowing down'  'biking up south 1st  only to find my new apartment only blocks from your salon' 'Wanting to jump in barton springs boots and all but they were dredging the pool for the summer season so I just sat back in my seat listen to some guitar players in the park and imagined it all'

We had a great stay! The condo was the perfect place for 2 of us for a long weekend in Austin. Very clean loved the wood floors. Angele was a very good host and very willing to answer questions. Nice safe neighborhood within short walking distance to many shops and restaurants as well as the bus stops. We didn't rent a car and only took the bus a few times and were kept more than busy. I'd certainly stay here again for a return trip and highly recommend it to others. Thanks!
Sovay's home was nice clean and comfortable. I appreciated her friendliness laid back attitude and humor. I would gladly visit Austin again and stay with Sovay and her two beautiful dogs!
I had a wonderful time with wonderful hosts in peaceful & relaxing surrounds. Courtney & Joep have an easy hospitality and I highly recommend them as hosts!

Very accommodating and helpful host.  We had different folks meeting up throughout the weekend and he was ok with letting us add people as needed and left extra payment for the extra guests last minute.  Also someone needed to stay behind and the place was available and since it was not reserved for that day she was able to leave payment for the extra night.  Nice neighborhood if you are in your late 20's or 30 and above this is the spot.  Not too far from the cooler/divey part of 6th street.  Also includes parking spot which is convenient I think you would want to have a rental if you are going to stay at this part of town.  Will definitely look to stay here again when visiting Austin in the future.

Robbie's house is so unique and interesting while her attention to detail as a host is impeccable. She left a printed welcome message with a few instructions and tips to help make our stay great. My husband wanted me to mention that he admired the well-curated film and book collection--so kudos on that; it takes a lot to impress him on that front. (:

With three lovely patios it's hard to choose a favorite but mine would have to be the rooftop area. What a relaxing place to sit and watch the sunrise/set. The house is minimally and beautifully decorated--if I were you I might just leave the shoes at the front door if you're comfortable. It'll save any worry that you'll mar the carpets.

All members of our group just wanted to take the cloud-like beds home with us. Oh my goodness. We wasted Austin sightseeing time because we didn't want to climb out of bed. Everything was immaculately clean--towels plenty of pillows and even little travel toiletries were provided in case we needed them. Robbie was very responsive and friendly and all in all knocked this first Airbnb stay completely out of the park! We loved it.
The host canceled my reservation 8 days before arrival.

Angele's Condo is a little treasure in the heart of Austin. We were within walking distance of W Sixth but still had the convenience of staying in a quiet neighborhood. Couldn't have placed the condo any more perfectly for our stay! When we arrived we were a bit early for checkin and got to meet Angele's husband and adorable little boy who gave us a quick tour of the place. We loved having the wifi and honestly not having a tv was a plus for us. Kept us out of the apartment and enjoying what Austin had to offer. The bed was huge and comfy the apartment was cool in the daytime without the air running thanks to two awesome ceiling fans (remote controlled!) and the storage space for our things was extravagant. The kitchen was beautiful - my husband decided if we redo our kitchen we'll take some pointers from theirs. I felt like I was right at home within about five minutes of unpacking. We had a wonderful time & will be staying here the next time we are in town! Thanks again Angele!

What a lovely space and what a gracious host!  :-)  We so enjoyed our time in Austin and Sylvia played a big role!  In addition to being conveniently located within walking distance from downtown South Congress and East 6th Street (not to mention very close to some key bus routes!) this little apartment was wonderful to come home to - very clean and comfortable with a few treats in the kitchen and a fun video collection for winding down.  Sylvia offered us some great suggestions (we especially appreciated learning about Mr. Natural!) and she was so kind to offer us a ride back to the airport.  We will gladly recommend Sylvia and this apartment to anyone we know who is heading to Austin and we would most definitely stay here again!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments:
We could not have been happier with our stay.  
Dolina and Yohan made us so very comfortable they are fantastic hosts.  We recently moved from Boston to Austin and needed short term furnished accommodations while we sorted out more permanent living.  The Casita has everything you could want ....a very comfortable bed fully functioning kitchen with a microwave/convection oven a stylish and cosy seating area packed with books and games great outdoor space and the location is fabulous.  Its central-south location is convenient to everything but also just far enough removed to grant a peaceful serene get-away.  Its a private little get away in the heart of it all.  Never a problem with the wi-fi connection and did we mention great outdoor space to sit and relax.  We could not have asked for a better introduction to Austin and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  
Dolina and Yohan are the most gracious and lovely hosts we have already recommended the "Birdhouse" to friends both here in Austin and back in Boston.  
Thanks so very much to you all and Lucy too.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Great clean modern - all things in order exactly as Fred said.  Easy in/out - great location.  Great stay -- only drawback was slightly creep art -- huge photos of baroque/evil-ish doll faces in living room... other than that great!

I really enjoyed my stay at the cosy casita. ?ÿAside from being a unique retreat in a great part of Austin I also thought the hosts were warm thoughtful and accommodating. Dolina and Yohan provided a vegetarian breakfast and vegan treats which absolutely made me feel at home!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Sara was absolutely wonderful and sheƒ??s done a great job with her cottage.  The shower & bathroom (not entirely pictured) were really cool. Itƒ??s a beautiful comfortable place to stay.  We were there 4 nights and had everything we needed.  We asked Sara for recommendations about places to eat and she was more than happy to help.  The places she suggested were excellent.  The bikes were super loved having them.  The dog was a sweetie!

Dolina was a fabulous host! She made us feel welcomed--even pampered--during our stay. With its comfy bed and even a reading loft "cozy" is the perfect description for the casita. It's a beautiful and thoughtfully-designed space.

The location and the price can't be beat as well.  

Thanks Dolina!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: We enjoyed our stay with Sovay Reeder. She was very accomodating and helpful regarding activities restaurants etc in Austin and the area. The arrangement at her house was (email hidden)ivate bathroom plenty of storage and wonderful living room and kitchen space. I would recommend Sovay to anyone visiting Austin.

Great location awesome private bath and bed room!  Close to downtown and great place over all!  The place was immaculate and she had all of the amenities needed in the the Kitchen.

Sovay was an excellent host and I will book with her first next time I'm in town!

Dolina's cozy casita is an absolute marvel! Outfitted with unique local art and a bookshelf brimming with interesting reads the light filled Birdhouse is absolutely perfect and not to mention conveniently located near SoCo

Most importantly Dolina was a wonderful host! From providing helpful information about how best to arrive from the airport to drawing us a handmade map on our first evening in town Dolina made us feel welcome from the moment our reservation was booked. She even lent a helping hand when our second airbnb reservation backfired! 

I only wish we could've stayed at the Birdhouse longer. It's a popular place to stay for good reason! If you have the opportunity to stay in the Birdhouse  you'd fall in love with it too!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments:
Marcus has a great spot in Austin and is a great Host. 

If I am ever in town again I will definitely try to use his place.

A great experience

10/10 :)

Staying with Ashley for SXSW was a great experience. Her home has tons of character and is just 1mile from downtown. Being an artist her home is filled with loads of creative books and decor and has a very lived-in feeling to it. This house is great for families that need a large kitchen or for creatives that want an inspiring home away from home. Ashley is an amazing host that picked that went above and beyond including driving me around the city and taking me to one of the famous Austin Taco trucks. I highly recommend staying at Ashley's.
listing_name: FAB 2 bDR where Airbnb CEO stays!

comments: It was such a pleasure to stay with Andy. The cottage is beyond adorable and perfect for anyone needing a comfortable private space to stay in Austin. Andy and his wife were incredibly hospitable and kind.Thank you for such a wonderful experience.

Matt was super accomodating to our last minute needs.  We booked the day before our stay and he had everything ready.  His place is super pet-friendly (friendly cat).  I would recommend to anyone who doesn't mind a short drive downtown.

I had a great time. Tammy was helpful (let me in at the middle of the night gave me directions) and her home is so comfortable and charming. I wish my home were so tasteful and organized! Better than a hotel!
Vivian was very nice and made our stay very pleasant! The townhome is spacious and neat!
She was a great hostess. Very hospitable and nice.

Lynne was a wonderful host who went the extra mile across the board and the apartment was excellent. The location right next to Zilker Park and 5-10 minutes from downtown worked out perfectly for SXSW.

Would definitely stay here again.
The accommodations were clean spacious and everything I needed and then some.  The hostess was sweet kind and provided excellent services.  A great stay and I'd easily rent from her again.
Place was clean and tidy. Megan was super accommodating and helpful. Couldn't have asked for more.

Martin was a very gracious host while at sxsw in March. Tastefully renovated property that slept 4 comfortably and was a quick drive to downtown and local markets. The guesthouse was clean upon arrival and Martin even filled the kitchen with snacks and refreshments. A true delight and we would love to stay here again next year!
listing_name: Mod Guesthouse walk or bike to ACL

comments:
This house everything about it charms.  Thoughtfully decorated well appointed. Spacious.  Light filled.  A warm soul that feels like it's cared and lived in but in such a way that made me feel 'at home' vs. invited.  Everything I needed for my SXSW trip was there - the highlight of which included fresh eggs each morning!  It surpassed any and all of my expectations.

As a host though we didn't meet Molly treated me like an old family friend even offering and planning to pick me up from the airport and show me around before she left on her own vacation.  I can't say enough about how gracious Molly was and as a result how pleasant a stay I had.

A couple of notes.  In the concierge department Molly was all business.  Ready for me were notes guides maps telephone numbers clean sheets towels soap and toilettries and in general an all access pass to the amenities (including bikes btw!).

All in all an exceptional experience.

We had a great time in Austin staying at Paddy's house. The house is much larger than it looks on the photos very clean and the moment you step in you feel like home. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again next time I'm back in Austin.
listing_name: Zen-East in the Heart of Austin

comments: Had a nice wing of the house. Friendly people. 10 minutes to downtown on the bus.
listing_name: Tower Suite - Fab in central Austin

comments: We had a wonderful time at Michelle's house. Michelle was very accommodating and helpful with information on the area the house itself was perfect ƒ?? lots of space and very well taken care of ƒ?? and the neighborhood was great ƒ?? a few cool restaurants and a bakery right down the street. I would highly recommend staying here.

I just returned from this property and my first visit to Austin - what an amazing city! Kelly and family are extremely hospitable and made me feel very comfortable. I loved loved loved the apartment; it looks EXACTLY like the photos - clean private just a short ride from downtown and just perfect for a stay in this great city. I highly recommend this property and would definitely stay here again.

Sylvia was a friendly host the apartment was good for a short stay -- very bright and sunny with birds singing out the window. Very useful to have a small kitchen with cheery fiesta plateware. This is good for one or two people - excellent location as it's close to downtown walkable distance -- good running trail by lake closeby too.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay while I was in Austin. The place itself was not only beautiful but very functional and well-stocked with all the necessities. Bed was comfortable shower was great lots of windows and light and nice outdoor sitting area. The location is convenient and just a short bus ride to downtown. Dolina was a great host and even left us a few treats for breakfast. The whole process was very smooth and if I'm ever back in Austin I'll definitely be staying here again. It's places like these that make me wonder why anyone would stay in a hotel :)
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Great space great host. South Congress is one of my favourite streets in the world and this airy apartment is just off the strip. Cannot recommend strongly enough.

We rented the house out for our team to have a head quarters during SXSWi and we absolutely loved it!  The house is located in a quiet residential area far enough away from all the action that you are easily able to come and enjoy some down time on one of the many decks or even inside with how bright and relaxing it is.

Great little place.  Quiet and private with a "industrial" feel to the inside which was very cool.  Nice shower.  She even left beer in the fridge for me!  A beautiful walk to downtown as well.  Easy to find and really easy to stay.
listing_name: Villa in Central Austin for ACL!

comments:
My stay with Jaime and Mike was one of the easiest and most pleasant experiences I have ever had!!  I went to Austin during the madness of SXSW and staying with them was peaceful and gave me a chance to relax.  They were both so attentive to my needs and offered advice about transportation restaurants etc.
The guest house itself is cute quiet clean and homey.  I really didn't want to leave.  In fact I requested to stay an extra night and they were extremely flexible and accommodating.
I really cant say enough nice things about my host the house and the location.  I will definitely be back if they will have me :)

I stayed at this great condo on the south of the lake in Austin for SXSW 2011. According to David it had just been remodeled and it looked it everything was brand new and ready to go. The decorations added some personality and I felt right at home. I was pleasantly surprised to find beer in the fridge coffee on the counter and clean towels and linens everywhere.

I was by myself but the place could easily have fit 3+ with its queen bed and pullout couch. There's a really big living-room with an attached kitchen and porch separate bedroom/closet and you can walk down to the pier on the lake in just 2 minutes. It's situated right by a great park where people jog and play sports.

It's about 1 1/2 miles from the convention center/downtown which is a decent walk but there is a bus stop just around the corner which works well too. For something like SXSW it was perfect to be away from all the hustle and bustle and actually get some sleep. Basically - not downtown but close enough for a decent walk - easier than staying in a hotel by the airport and a darn lot nicer.  Cabs work too.

I would recommend it to anyone looking for a little quite time during their visit to Austin!
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: Courtney and Joep made my Austin experience a wonderful one they are great hosts and the accomodation is perfect. I truly did enjoy staying with them and can only recommend it!

Lois' place was a perfect spot for our group during our attendance of SXSW Interactive 2011. The location is conveniently located near a city bus and film shuttle pickup and contains all the basics you need - bathroom shower electricity and a place to sleep. We stayed in a party of 3 - one couple and one single - and fit perfectly on the floor and in the loft. Cozy little space and an excellent sample of what "Keep Austin Weird" is all about. Thanks Lois!

Nice comfortable house with a big garden. Quiet pleasant neighborhood.
Owner easy going and helpful.
Best to have a car to get to  downtown.

As it show in the picture room was very clean. Viviane was a great host. She go out of her way to make you feel comfortable. She even offer me her Bus Pass to go to downtown on first day. I can highly recommended any one want to use her facility.
Safe neighborhood and a generous host!

Sovay is an amazing host! She took great care of me during my entire stay. The house is as cozy as it looks in the photos the bed is super comfortable and the location is great. I would stay with her again in a heartbeat.

This is a beautiful home that was perfect for our needs. A short drive (or a long but definitely doable walk) to downtown and only a couple blocks away from all kinds of good stuff on South Congress.

Tamara is a great host. She provided us with everything we needed including helpful information on navigating Austin. The place is clean and modern and nicely decorated.

Would be a perfect spot for a couple with ample living space but definitely also suitable for two non-couple guests (which was our situation).

Highly recommended. I can't think of anything that would have made our stay better.
Nice one room mother's-in-law style apartment/music studio.

Paula's house is a great retreat especially from the frantic place that Austin becomes during SXSW. Paula is a great host and exceptionally kind - I felt really well looked after considered. You will have everything you need and the chance to hear some great music. It's worth bearing in mind that for the festival you are a 20min bus ride away and it's worth orientating yourself with the Austin CapMetro quickly.

Overall a great stay!!
listing_name: Queen Bed comfortable home in SOLA

comments:
It's a very nice house. Almost everything about it is wonderful. It has a nice spacious kitchen if you cook a very convenient washer/dryer combo and it's a quick bus or bike ride from downtown. 

Just beware the trains! There's a freight line a few blocks away that runs 24/7. Was not much of a problem for me but occasionally I was stirred awake by a horn that rang loud and close for a long time (from rather inconsiderate engineers). Most of the train horns are just odd and soft background noise. Earplugs would totally do the trick if you're a light sleeper.

Marcus was amazing. He gave us a lot of privacy and he checked in via text every morning to make sure that we're doing well. 

The Guest House has everything:
- high speed internet 
- a big ol' fridge
- coffee + coffee machine
- a stove
- two sinks (VERY helpful for me and my husband)
- snacks (thank you Marcus!)
- juice

We had a lovely time. It was MUCH better than staying at a hotel. There's also plenty of parking on the street and the bus stop is a couple of blocks away.

Todd and Amy's place is really fantastic - totally up-to-date beautifully furnished very clean-- and you even have your own private patio!  It felt absolutely comfortable and - dare I say? - luxurious.  The studio is perfectly located between downtown Austin and Austin's fun and hip Soco neighborhood.  If you're coming to Austin for SXSW you'll be perfectly located (an easy 15 minute walk to the Convention Center) and you'll find that this place offers a lovely peaceful respite from the fast-paced and frenzied SXSW environment.  Todd and Amy were very gracious hosts helping me get settled in and answering all my "Austin newbie" queries.  They even set me up with some coffee beans and tea upon my arrival...it's the little things!  They're glad to share their awesome city with others and you'll be happy to have them as a resource during your stay.
listing_name: Gem of a Studio near Downtown

comments: Excellent host prompt and courteous communication. The apartment is a delight and I truly enjoyed staying there! Highly recommend Fred as a host and would love to stay there again!
The house is clean and beautiful.  Renee made accommodations for 2 extra mattresses for us.  We had a great experience!
What a fabulous place! I'm totally envious of this living quarter. We didn't get to meet Sean in person but he is super nice and responsive over email. 5 stars all around.
listing_name: West Campus Beauty on Washington Sq

comments:
We had a great experience staying with Marcus. He was extremely helpful and hospitable (and has a great sense of humor to boot!). He provided detailed directions and gave us a different set of directions when my boyfriend and I decided to take a bus into Austin rather than a train. 
The room where we stayed was spotless and full of character and is only a two-minute jaunt to the #7 bus stop which takes you straight downtown. Would definitely stay here again!

Ashley describes the apartment as big and cozy and she isn't kidding in either respect. It's definitely big and cozy! Great decor and very charming. Big comfortable bed. The place is pretty clean and organized. Nice little private backyard area. There is a parking spot right in front of the apartment which is convenient. The place is about 2 miles from downtown Austin - everything seems to be about a 10 minute drive away from her apartment. Ashley is very sweet and hospitable. Even though she was really busy while I was staying there she made sure to respond to all text messages and emails promptly to ensure that I had a comfortable stay. Thanks Ashley!
Lin is an excellent host with lots of local knowledge of Austin. The house is comfortable with the charming horse ranch style living.
Everything as promised. Ms. Simms was very responsive and even baked scones! A pleasant stay.

An amazing place to stay with a gorgeous interior and fantastic location - right by the Magnolia Cafe. Steven and Becca are wonderful hosts they provide loads of info on where to visit how to get there and also left us a little welcome pack of nibbles and wine. Really great experience from initial query email to (sadly) leaving and handing back the keys! 

Highly recommended! 

Thank you
Sally

Alyson was a fantastic host! Her place is comfortable and relaxing. The location is perfect. We walked/jogged to Zilker Park and right into downtown to check out the city. I would do it all over again!

My husband and two kids stayed in Lynne's place over spring break for a couple of nights. The studio had everything we needed: water coffee laundry and beach towels. We usually cook when we travel but this was a quick enough trip that we just ate out or at friends' houses we were visiting. If we weren't out and about so much I might say that the place is a little too small for a family of four (especially if your kids are of the "he pinched me!" variety as mine are). But it was perfect for the kind of trip we were on. Lovely balcony to drink my coffee on killer location for any Zilker Park activities. Lynne was a sweetheart to deal with and even left us a cool Groupon redeemable at a frozen banana trailer (I suggest you sample all the trailers you can!) called Bananarchy. We used it happily. We highly recommend Lynne's place. She sent us wonderful resources regarding restaurants and activities which we definitely would have used more if we were there longer with less structured time. Thank you Lynne!
Tammy was helpful gregacious and organized. The place is clean and lovely. I was very pleased with ny stay.

When I booked the apartment it was still being renovated and there where only a handful of pictures available mainly from outside. Luckly David explained the situation and when I arrived there I was pleasantly surprised the apartment was decorated beautifully was clean and had everything we needed.
David is a kind and friendly man he helped us out and gave us some tips about the area (eg. take a bus for one dollar to downtown especially during SXSW its hard to get a hold of taxis so the bus is really a great help).
The neighborhood is nice and pretty close to Downtown (its about an 8 dollar cab ride to Stubbs which is nice). There is a 7/11 around the corner so if you need to do some late night snacking its pretty convenient.
We didn't really have time to walk by the lake which is a real shame cause its so very pretty.
We will probably try to get this apartment for next years SXSW from all 3 places we stayed this year (thats what you get for booking late) this was definitely the one that pleasantly surprised us the most.
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments:
This stay was remarkably pleasant and a great private situation in a separate building from the main house with almost all the amenities I would want for an extended stay except the regular use of a kitchen and refrigerator (though Dan did supply a small cooler with ice for our groceries upon request; and he did let us use his kitchen in the main house when he was around). It is plenty spacious and has a lovely (though small) bathroom.

The real pleasure of staying at this place is the backyard which Dan created from scratch. It has grapes growing a back shed full of wonderful folk art that Dan made himself a nice deck with patio chairs to lounge in and a bamboo and cactus garden as well as many hanging plants. It's really a nice place to spend a luxurious afternoon or evening.

This place is better if you have a rental car or bike as it is a rather long walk to and from the closest bus stops where frequently-running buses run and from the main drags (South Congress and Lamar though it is relatively close to S. 1st St which has buses running frequently).

Otherwise it was a very pleasant experience (shared for two) and Dan is a great laid-back guy with great taste in music and a great knowledge of Austin and much of Texas should you need any guidance (especially in South Austin and Downtown).
Joep and Courtney were more than generous and accommodating.  Really nice and easy to make conversation with.
Lois' cute little bungalow was a clean tranquil retreat from the bustle of SXSW. I would definitely stay here again.
Megan was the nicest most accomodating host ever. I'd recommand her to anyone.

Host was helpful flexible and easy to communicate with. It was so nice to stay in a loft as opposed to a hotel. We were very comfortable and felt at home there. Good location close to downtown and great east side restaurants.
Extremely nice place and hosts. They were helpful and accommodating in every way possible. Highly recommended
listing_name: Mod Guesthouse walk or bike to ACL

comments: Vivian's place was great and she was very accommodating.  It is an easy trip to downtown Austin and having this place made our SXSW extremely easy.  Thanks Vivian!

The one of Viviane and Michael is one of those cases in which the photos do not do well enough the enchanting beauty of the house. Big house with open plan ground floor furnished with great taste and warmth unusual: it feels right at home! The room was beautiful and spotless with a big private bathroom. The house overlooks a park on the hills of Austin in a very quiet and peaceful area of very beautiful houses surrounded by greenery. Convenient to get to downtown with bus and inexpensively by taxi at night to return.Viviane and Michael are two perfect hosts very friendly cordial open friendly and distinct with a great taste for life. Michael has prepared especially for me one of his famous cheesecake: very good. I thank you again.

This was my first AirBnB experience and it was definitely a top-notch experience! Ashley is an amazing host. We were able to spend some time hanging out so not only did I have a great place to stay during SXSW but I now have an amazing friend in Austin. Thanks!
listing_name: FAB 2 bDR where Airbnb CEO stays!

comments: Nat was very friendly and quick in responses.  The apartment is nice conveniently located and comfortable.  Had a fantastic time!
listing_name: HIGH Tech Luxury w/ Incredible View

comments: A very nice house in a very convenient location. Clean and comfortable. I have no complaints! Sovay is awesome. Extremely generous and kind. An all around good person. She let me borrow her bike which was really cool.  Very friendly and fun and easy to be around has two nice dogs and a beautiful house. Two thumbs up! Thanks Sovay!
Wow... what a great house. Tamara's taste is impeccable she was super hospitable and the location was wonderful. I would definitely want to stay here again... if I could give it more stars I would!

Paula's place was great! The bed was comfy the room was quiet and her house is clean and cozy. She was very welcoming and made my boyfriend and I feel at home. She also has the sweetest dog ever. The location was lovely - residential but just a ten minute drive to downtown and close to a few great brunch spots. The house also has an AMAZING back porch overlooking lots of trees. It was the perfect spot for sipping coffee in the morning and made it easy to forget you were within the city limits. This was my first experience using Airbnb and I couldn't have asked for more!
listing_name: Queen Bed comfortable home in SOLA

comments:
Hope was a great host over the phone. 
Her space was well thought out and left us intrigued as we inhabited the room with nerf gun decor. Thank you hope we will be back next year!

This truly is an adorable bungalow. The location was wonderful. We were close to plenty of restaurants and a wonderful coffee shop. The buses in Austin ran smoothly and the cost of only $2.00 for the entire day made it an easy and affordable way to get around the city. The house was equipped with everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. Susan's house is close to a train but was not bad at all. Susan even provided ear plugs just in case. They were not necessary. I would stay here again. It was a great trip!

Great people; the host Jason (if you're italian you can call him Giasone) is a great person. We enjoyed staying in his house. Beds are very comfortable. The neighborhood is quiet and you can find all you need in walk distance.

Great location great little apartment great host!

The location is awesome cause its only three miles from downtown but also has plenty of cool restaurants nearby not to mention Central Market is just around the corner.

The place was the perfect size and with the bathroom split between two room getting ready with multiple people was made much easier. Also to call it an apartment is an understatement cause its more like a complex! We started our days with mimosas on the rooftop patio and yes even climbed through the fort. It was nice that the whole place was fenced in because I never had to worry about our bikes at night.

The host Marcus was the cherry on top! Not only was he friendly and accommodation but was also more than willing to act as tour guide to us out-of-towners. Marcus was even kind enough to give me a ride downtown one day! 

I would definitely recommend staying here and both me and my friends will remember it for future trips to Austin!
Really enjoyed having my own private "home" after a hectic day downtown. The birdhouse is really a top location for those willing to stay a little bit outside of city centre.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Suzanne was a wonderful accommodating host!
listing_name: Villa in Central Austin for ACL!

comments: Great hosts!  Place was very cozy and relaxing!

With a new job on hand along with a busy schedule I had to cross SXSW off of my to-do list cancelling my hotel room and so forth.  As the final week went by I got the SXSW itch and just had to go.  I began calling hotels even tried to get the room back that I had given away but prices ofcourse had skyrocketed for the festival.  

Then I stumbled upon airbnb.com and quickly noticed the great condo being offered by David.  Being a rookie with airbnb I just followed along really not expecting a response but to my surprise David responded within 30 minutes and it was a go!  

I had a crazy time getting into Austin and David went out of his way to make my stay comfortable.  He even had the amenities of coffee and beer in the fridge.  The bed was comfortable and the place was a lot more  spacious then I even would have thought and even better it is right on Townlake(a major plus in my book!!!  Only a 15 minute walk from downtwon.   I could not have asked for a better deal!!!!

Thanks David!!
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments:
We had a really nice time staying here during SXSW. Kevin was a lovely host and very helpful when we got lost in the one bad neighbourhood of Austin. 

Close to the university and lots of bus routes into town. Would definitely stay here again!
perfect!---:)  Will stay again!
This was my first experience using this site and it could not have been any better or easier with Alyson. Would stay with her anytime i go to austin.
A great place with great and very helpful hosts.

My friends and I stayed at Sylvia's place for SXSW and had a great time. She was a very helpful host with lots of information and her apartment was a quiet refuge from all the craziness of 6th Street. It was easy walking distance to almost everywhere we wanted to go and the perfect home base in the city.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: Tyler was an awesome host! He made sure to make my friend and I feel at home as much as he could. He has recently been added to the list of funniest people I have encountered. If you have a chance to stay with him I recommend it.
listing_name: South Austin Aptmnt Room for rent

comments: Sovay's place in Zilker is fantastic. The room was perfect for one (maybe two)ƒ??everything clean and immaculate just as it looks in the picsƒ??and the espresso machine an added bonus. All in all a great experience one I'd definitely recommend. If ever I'm in Austin again I would gladly stay here again.

Let me start off by saying that Elizabeth and David are amazing people to get to know they are very helpful and are great hosts!  The area in NW is peaceful the house is beautiful and cozy and I love the backyard.  I will highly recommend my family and friends and anyone to stay with them while visiting Austin.

I had the best time staying at this great condo on the lake. It was everything that I was expecting and more.  David  picked me up from the airport and offered some great suggestions for things to see and places to eat.  The condo is spacious and beautifully furnished.  I enjoyed sitting on the dock in the evening and enjoying the view of downtown and the beauty of the lake. It was a much nicer experience than staying in a hotel and I would highly recommend it. Thanks David!
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: This lovely condo was just what I was looking for during my business trip to Austin. It was very close to downtown but not too close and allowed me to get away each evening for some quiet time. Everything was brand new the unit was clean and tastefully decorated. David met me on time and was very friendly and accommodating. He even told me where to get the best Tex Mex food and veggie fare. I will definitely return whenever I travel to Austin.
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: We had a lovely stay with Joep and Courtney. They welcomed us into their home and were great company offering many local tips on what to see and do. The room was spacious clean and tidy. Our time in Austin was much more memorable because of Joep and Courtney. We are so glad we had the opportunity to meet such kind and gracious people during our travels. Thankyou
Great Place!
Fabulous and lovely cottage in a great (and quiet) location! I loved the Austin/music memorabilia decor - very unique. Hosts stocked the kitchen with breakfast too!

What a pleasant and kitchy place to stay! If you're planning a trip to Austin you'll be pleased with this place. It's definitely a piece of the "Keeping Austin Wierd" puzzle and offers privacy comfort and calm. I didn't get to meet Lois but everything was ready and in order and I would stay again in a heartbeat. Thanks Lois!

This was just what I needed. I was sunburned tired and getting cranky but I got to spend the evening reading and relaxing here. It is a fun place to explore. I really like the windchimes/mobile made from silverware and a teapot. All the colors are cheerful and there are tons of pillows and bedding available to make you comfortable. The loft was cool! I sat up there for a little bit but decided not to sleep there since moving around was a little painful with the sunburn. It is peaceful private but still fun!
Gorgeous loft great location! We've really enjoyed the stay. Thanks Fred for your excellent support!
Great place to stay - friendly hosts cute private setup with full kitchen and bath in quiet neighborhood. Probably need a car to stay here and get around though. Would definitely recommend.

I had a great stay in Tammy's house ! It was nice clean convinient. It is very quite in the area where she lives so i could hear beautiful (!) birds chirping in the morning when i woke up - i loved it :-)  When i came to Austin she even met me up in the airport. I m not saying - because i dont know - it s gonna happen to the other guests - it is just meant to show Tammy's attitude to her guests and her readiness to help! Thank you  Tammy for a great stay ! PS: the dogs in the house are very friendly and cute!

I rented Susan's place for three people and it was very comfortable very clean and in a great part of town.   She and her brother were very responsive and responsible about getting us settled.  Thank you!

We had a fabulous stay at the condo. It was cosy stocked and had everything we needed for the whole month. Thanks so much Angele for being a wonderful host. I'd recommend you any time and we'll be keeping in touch for future visits!
David and Elizabeth are nice friendly people and their house is in a nice quiet neighborhood.  I enjoyed my stay there and the room was comfortable and clean.

Sevylla studio space was bright clean colorful and comfortable. She was a great host and was easily available to accommodate my requests. This location is quiet with convenient parking and easy access to the freeway and all of the hot spots without being on the main drag. Stay at Sevyllas's!
Andy's place is very clean and comfortable. It has everything I need and the location is excellent. Andy is a great host and will surely stay again.
Great place to stay good price clean stylish quiet - I'll be back!

Sylvia's place is terrific she has put a lot of thought into providing for guests needs and Sylvia is terrifically hospitable. The place is very conveniently located for downtown within walking distance of the Convention Center State House E.6th St and more. Thanks Sylvia.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments:
An absolutely charming and real Austin experience.  The garage apartment is fully equipped with wireless google phone a full kitchenette area living and dinette area bedroom and very large bathroom.  

At every turn it seemed as though there as an extra amenity not mentioned in the description - wine refrigerator and a color printer!

This isn't to mention the very close proximity (1 block) to South Congress one of Austin's most amazing cultural streets.  As well the walk downtown and to 6th street is less than 30 minutes.

I would highly recommend the apartment.  Mr Breen was a gracious apartment host and the overall experience was much more than what I could have expected.

I wanted to try a different part of Austin away from all of the hub bub of it all...the word that attracted me to Tammy's place was an "oasis" in her backyard. I found it in her backyard; a peaceful quiet spot about 20 minutes by car to where all the action is. 
It was just what I needed; Tammy was friendly fun and respectful. I will certainly return in the future while visiting family in the area!

The place was absolutely amazing.  Everything from her artwork and the colors to the yard and design were beautiful and peaceful.  It was a great place to get away from the city while still being able to drive downtown in 10 minutes.  Lois was a great host and we will def be staying with her again the next time we're in Austin hopefully.

I had a great stay at Brian's garden apartment. The place was clean and exactly as described. Very quiet neighborhood and I felt safe.  His yard is a little bit of heaven. It's filled with trees a hammock a fire pit lots of birds singing in the morning and afternoon. Also where ever I looked I saw some art work hanging or lurking in the shrubs....very cool!!! Can't wait to stay here again.

Great place to stay and about a $7.00 cab ride to downtown.  Angele is really sweet! I'd definitely stay again!  No complaints.  Nice and cool conditioner/fans/ventilation throughout the place too (in case you're thinking about visiting during the summer heat).

Kelly was a great host providing us with some fruit drink and purified water on arrival. We try to stay in a different area each time we visit Austin and this pad is in an ideal location for seeing the city yet feeling like you are far enough away from the noise of the city. It is situated perfectly between the Whole Foods lake trail and some great food and coffee shops. You can't go wrong with this apartment.

Sylvia's studio apt was very cute clean and comfortable. It was very close to downtown and a great deal! I would definitely recommend this place- even though it's near the interstate it was very quiet and a peaceful spot to come back to after partying or walking all day. Very nice VHS collection books and maps of Austin! Thanks Sylvia!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: The perfect stay everything we needed with style to spare. The location in the St. Edwards neighborhood is near enough to SoCo's action but at enough of a distance that you can relax.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Recommended to all! Lynne was an awesome host who was always available for any questions we had. The condo has everything you could possibly need including materials to cook extra towels linens wifi and a washer/dryer. It is tastefully decorated and charming. We had a great time during our stay in Austin and much of that came from staying in such a lovely condo with a lovely location. Thanks again!

Adorable little cottage! Conveniently located + charming quiet neighborhood. Very comfortable and kitchen well-stocked (a pleasant surprise). Hosts were very friendly; un-intrusive. What more can I say? I would stay again and recommend others.

Stayed for a short vacation dovetailing into a conference. This was a lovely place--super clean convenient to downtown by bus or car or bike--maybe a bit too far to walk.  Having a beer on the dock looking across the river to the city ROCKED!  Especially convenient to South Congress.  Gigundo TV with a bazillion channels was a fun distraction in the wee hours (I guess for those of us who aren't used to that sort of thing.)  Good stuff. David was very friendly and easy to communicate with.
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: Sevylla was an excellent host. The space was much bigger than I anticipated... Could easily fit 5 people. Private entrance and soundproof walls made it feel like a studio apartment in LA.... Full access to a washer and dryer that sits in-between the two spaces so you can do all your laundry and never disturb anyone. Sevylla and her family are super nice down2 earth people. For what she charged this place was a steal! And the few times I got to talk to the family was time well spent. Very interesting family. If I visit Austin again I would def stay with them a second time.
Very peaceful place in secluded cul de sac.. A great getaway from pace of city and noise. If you want peace without distraction this is your place.

two of my friends and I stayed here over the course of a week. And had an amazing time close to Congress and a revitalized S. First. As well as astonishingly close to S. Lamar. Also the neighbors were very welcoming and charming as well. Great Great place.
Simple clean and comforatable.  Sylvia is very nice.  The location is within easy walking distance of downtown for a third of the price (downtown hotels).
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: My boyfriend and I were checking out Austin to inquire about a possible relocation.  The birdhouse was the perfect place to stay! Great location Dolina and her family were more than accomadating and our experience in Austin couldn't have been any better.  What a lovely get-away. Im so happy I stumbled upon this website.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Sylvia was great -- very friendly the place was lovely and as described. Just a few minutes to East 6th and 15 or so to downtown. Would definitely stay here again.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments:
I highly recommend The Rusty Box!!!  It is a delightful and unusual experience.  It was like being inside of a contemporary minimalist art piece.  And for an artist that is a real treat.  It was a visual and sensual pleasure to move around in the light open space.  The combined design and materials of The Rusty Box tucked under the branches of a huge Live Oak tree in the back yard made it feel like a tree house especially in the master bedroom.

Everything that is written in the description is accurate and much more.  It is a very centrally located and within walking distance of a hip eating and shopping area.  On the corner of the block is The Herb Bar which has an extensive array of natural health and body care products including Texas flower essences.  Also you an get a chair massage.

Becca is an excellent host as she made us feel right at home. She left us wine snacks and breakfast pastries.  She has prepared notes and magazines with information about the area and the house..   Be sure and read the section in the 2006 Austin AIA Homes Tour Book to get more information about Becca and Steve and the building of the house.  Very interesting. 

Thank you Becca and Steve for sharing your home. 

Penny Fred and Robyn
San Diego California

A brilliant location and a wonderful area if not the best location in Austin.
I would fully recommend this house. The host did not ask or put any restrictions on my stay. The perfect host.
Great place location and host. Absolutely perfect.

Sylvia's place is cute clean and very convenient. It's less than a mile's walk to 6th street! She has tons of maps and info for you there if you don't already know where you're going. Whenever we make it back to Austin we WILL be looking her up again!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: I have mixed feelings about this place. On the one hand I want to share it with everyone and yet no one for purely selfish reasons of course. However on behalf of my gracious hosts I will air on the side of the prior. It's a wonderful and peaceful place to stay. You won't find any better combination of privacy and hospitality. Thank you!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: The condo was cute and spacious with everything we needed! A few minutes to downtown and soco and a 7 11 next door but you don't want to go behind east of the 7 11 side....but it was perfect for 2 especially for first time visiting Austin. Host kept in contact with me and checked in with me often to make sure everything was running smoothly!
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: The Empty Nest was great! Gina was very welcoming and gave us good recommendations for places to eat and things to do while we were in Austin. A wonderful location--we would definitely stay here again.
It was very nice to stay with Marcus. The room is very nice the area pretty and convenient and Marcus makes sure everything is okay and relaxed.

I had a conference to go to at the ACC and this place was the perfect getaway. Close enough to be convenient. Far away enough to not be in the hustle-bustle of downtown. The neighborhood around Sylvia's place includes a great funky bookstore and a terrific public library. 

The space had everything I required and more. Full kitchen toiletries and towels in the bathroom a collection of movies music and things to read everything spotless. A nice porch and patio for enjoying the weather was an extra bonus. 

I have told all my Austin friends to put their friends here instead of the noisy crowded downtown hotels. Thanks so much to Sylvia for creating this great accommodation.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: The birdhouse made for a phenomenal stay in Austin this spring.  We highly recommend this space for a stay close to downtown and public transportation.  The beautiful decor and design was a beautiful addition to the trip and the space was just right for two.  Dolina kindly left coffee and breakfast for us which was much appreciated.  We look forward to coming back soon!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: We had a fabulous time chez Lois.  Very quirkyclean and comfortable.  Lois was very helpful with advice about Austin.  Would definitely stay again!

The cottage was really clean and cute in a lovely neighborhood. Andy and Ellen were friendly unintrusive hosts who considerately kept the kitchen stocked with little goodies. I would definitely recommend this spot!

I had a wonderful time staying at the condo in Clarksville.  Great Location!  Super cute neighborhood and really close to everything!  Loved the Whole Foods and Bookstore down the street.  Angele was great and very sweet!  I would definitely stay there again!  Highly recommend it!  Condo was cute and very clean!

This place was paradise for us.  What could be better than instantly becoming another neighbor in South Austin...even for a long weekend? Austin is such a fun city. Jaime and MIke were great hosts with an ability to read what we wanted giving us great local tips plenty of privacy suggestions for music restaurants the back way into the park you name it.  We loved the casita  and appreciated its charm and functionality more each day.  Beforehand we were a little worried about the bed being a futon but it was very comfortable.  We slept well.  We are envious that your trip is in front of you.  Go enjoy this nice space and these good people.
cozy efficiency type apt.-we were awakened by the birds serenading us in the morning (not too early).  Nice location furnished well.   Lynne provided fresh ground coffee and milk for our use.

My husband and I spent 4 lovely days in David's condo. It looks directly out onto a park and then you walk down a few short steps to the lake.We watched the scull rowers the turtles birds runners sunrise sunset and a fabulous view of Austin downtown at night. David was available when needed but that was all.

We had a wonderful time and we'll be sure to return again!
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: The loft apartment is actually quite big.   I rented it just for myself but three people could stay there easily if one sleeps in the cot that is set up.  The kitchen is fully stocked for cooking which is great.  The apartment is in East Austin just two miles from downtown.  The place was clean and comfortable and it has a great view of downtown.  It was also fun experiencing living in a loft for a few days.

Ashley's place was the perfect get-away retreat right in the middle of one of the best neighborhoods in Austin.  It was definitely big n' cozy and Ashley was such a pleasure to work with.  I contacted her late the night before for a last minute staycation and she was very accommodating.  Her home was very inviting and it fostered creativity and thinking which was exactly the type of environment I needed.

Amazing! I highly recommend staying at Dolina's Casita. 
I will never stay at a hotel again. 
This is truly the way to go when staying in Austin.
Charming great yard & trees private central to just about everything and Dolina & her husband were the best hosts you could ever imagine.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Great place to stay! Close to many walking trails and other outdoor activities. Sovay was an excellent hostfun to be around and very helpful.
Great clean space in a nice location.

We had such an amazing time staying at the Birdhouse! The cottage was comfy and there was so much beautiful light. We also made good use of the patios during our stay. Dolina and Yohan were wonderful hosts we hope to stay at the Birdhouse again!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Very cute cottage to stay in.  Close in location.  Hosts were very friendly and the cottage was set up with all the things we needed and more.  Thanks for a fun stay.

Fun Colorful Place! I enjoyed communicating with Lois. The location was great -walk to Barton Springs & Zilker Park.  Bus stop on the corner. 2 miles and a $1 later & you are downtown.  There was an issue with the cable tv box but was recified promptly.  I would totally stay at any of Lois' places in the future and if you are reading this I recommend you do as well.  My thanks to Lois Stan and her beautiful neighbor Gary. We had a Great Stay!
Tammy is friendly and easy to get to know .  She has a wonderful home - clean and lovingly maintained.
Staying in this condo was great.  The location was awesome.  We got to watch the crews rowing the boats early in the morning while having coffee.    The turtles were a real treat also.
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: Lois Goodman's space was very colorful very private. I loved it!  The location was serene and a 10 minute walk to Lamar or Barton Springs (coffee etc).  I've been to Austin several times but found some new spots from her recommendations!

This was the perfect spot - clean private comfortable and within walking distance to many desirable destinations. 

Sylvia was a welcoming and knowledgeable host who went out of her way to make sure we felt at home. When presented with a complaint she quickly resolved the issue. We would gladly stay here again!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: My husband and I stayed with Sovay for 5 nights and totally loved it. Extremely convenient to all the exciting areas by car local transport or even (longish) walking. Easy parking right in front. The accommodations were completely comfortable. Loved having kitchen privileges. Sovay is a delightful hostess and very helpful too. This was so much nicer than staying at a hotel. Very reasonably priced for Austin too! Don't hesitate to book with Sovay!!!
No problems and Sovay is personable and nice.

It was our first time using air bnb so we didn't know what to expect but Sylvia was so lovely and accommodating. She picked us up and dropped us off at the airport made sure we had all questions answered and made us feel at home! When we first arrived it was about 12:30am and she offered to drive us around the town and give us a tiny tour! We could not believe it! The house was cute and very clean and had everything you needed there! It was an amazing locationclose to 6th st and the bus stop. We had such a great time and would definitely recommend staying here!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: The condo was really lovely and David could not have been more helpful.  We enjoyed our stay so much that we plan to definitely come again.
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: I came from NJ on a new job in Austin  This place was of great help to me as its just 15 mins walk to office. There is also a bus stop very near this house to reach downtown  shopping etc.   Sevylla & family is friendly  nice to know them.   If it had a regular kitchen etc i would have permanently setlled !  :)

Great hotel alternative! Charming cottage right near Hyde Park and minutes to east Austin 6th street and South Congress. We loved the use of the bike rental and the cozy fireplace. We look forward to coming back!

The loft was roomy and comfortable. The location is ideal for those wanting to venture downtown. It was only a 15 minute walk to get to the night life on W. 6th. As soon as you walk in the artwork will have you mesmerized and each is a great conversation piece. The patio overlooked a spacious grassy area and had a nice view of downtown.  Fred is a wonderful host and was very accommodating. You can't go wrong with renting this place.

We really enjoyed our stay she is a wonderful hostess. There no better way to visit a city but to stay a hip local. Her house is very clean and quiet. I loved the espresso every morning. I would love to stay there any day over hyatt or Hilton because I made another good friend.

Marcus went out of his way to make us feel welcome.  We had a late arriving flight into Austin and Marcus stayed up to welcome us.  Each day at least once a day Marcus texted me to ask if everything was OK.  The one time I requested something he accommodated us right away.  The place itself was just what we needed.  It's not fancy but it was very clean and functional.  If you're more into enjoying the sounds and sights of Austin (rather than staying in bed all weekend -not that there is anything wrong with that :) this is a great home base.  Hyde Park is probably my favorite neighborhood in Austin and 'the fort' is smack-dab in the middle of all the beauty.   

There really wasn't a thing to complain about.  However in an attempt to be as honest as possible I will note that - as advertised - the bed is a futon.  It's no problem if you are a rockin' 20-something (after a fun night out you just need a place to collapse right?).  But if you are used to sleeping in a cushy bed keep in mind that we are talking about 4 inches of padding and that's about it.  The room is located in a separate building behind the main house - a big plus if you are seeking privacy.  There is someone living above the room so you will hear occasional footsteps.  However the noise was minimal and didn't bother us in the least.  The upstairs unit opens up to a great patio that overlooks the quaint neighborhood houses and mesmerizing pecan trees.  It was a lovely place to enjoy our morning tea.

There was plenty of amazing local ground coffee in the freezer fresh half and half in the fridge maps and snacks on the dresser and a general feeling like your were being treated more like a family member rather than a nameless guest.  

Oh and after we had checked out my girlfriend realized that she had forgotten a special dress in the armoire.  I e-mailed Marcus the details and the dress was sent to her that day.  Two days and 700 miles later the dress and owner were reunited: what a guy!  I will recommend this place to any friend or family member time and time again.  Thank you Marcus!

wow what a great place! if going to austin and want to be able to be in the thick of it and also relax then this place is for you. wonderfully comfortable bed and little nook upstairs. great bathroom and shower. like staying in a hotel but your own place. dolina and her family were excellent hosts. i had very helpful lists and addresses of things to do (i had mentioned i wanted to hire a bike and there ere several bike hire places on the list) and freshly ground coffee organic chocolate and other goodies awaited my arrival. with a bus stop just round the corner and the bike i had hired i was downtown in no time and when i wanted to relax i had everything i needed in this amazing accommodation. highly recommend.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: The Hornungs were perfect hosts and the accommodations exceeded our expectations. We highly recommend this spot and will be returning!
My mom and I had a wonderful stay! The place was very clean and the fridge was stocked with breakfast goodies.  I will definitley stay there again my next time in Austin. Thanks Andy!
Lester is a great guy and an accommodating host.  He keeps his place clean and he is very friendly.  If I ever go back to Austin I would definitely check on his place first.
listing_name: SOCO One private room in a 2B house

comments: I was just getting over kidney stones and needed a break from the real world and a hair show to attend.  This place is AMAZING!!  Very Clean very BEAUTIFUL very SERENE!! I will definitely be back! It is also Perfectly located from downtown.  Thank you again!!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Tammy was awesome. Everything was great!

What a beautiful and satisfying place to stay with a marvellous host who helped me out in all manner of ways. Sovay dropped me off to buy new luggage at a great store only someone with local knowledge would have known about after my baggage was destroyed by the Southwest Handlers. Coupled with the fact she is a wonderful host and let me use her bicycle plus her equally wonderful dogs - it was easily the best place I stayed on my trip to the USA. And her place is so close to everything. Would recommend to anyone.

Sylvia is super friendly helpful AND the apartment is perfect for a stay in Austin. I rented a bike (though it was very easy to walk) and was able to get around quite easily. I'll be back when I come through Austin!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: What a calm and peaceful place to call home for a weekend in Austin.  Beautiful little living space and just thrilled to have found it!  Thank you for everything Lois!

Thank you Fred you're an excellent host! This is my second time I've stayed in your gorgeous loft and I don't have other than good words. I fully recommend this place is close to downtown has all amenities the loft is quite nice and Fred is always in contact for you to help in anything.
What an amazing little cottage! It had everything we could want. The hosts were great very thoughtful. We had a wonderful time.

We stayed here for the Austin to Shiner bike rally. Lynne's condo is in a beautiful location that's close to downtown but also is a quiet retreat. It's right off the Barton Greenbelt and Lady Bird Lake trails making it easy to go for a run too. The condo was great and had everything we needed. Grocery stores and restaurants are conveniently located close by. Lynne was easy to deal with and very helpful with information about the surrounding area. We'll definitely be staying here again for future Austin trips!

We had spent an excellent week with Elizabeth while we were waiting for our new home to become available.  It was a great relief to have a nice neighborhood and a backyard for my son to play in rather than being stuck in a hotel.

Everyone was very pleasant and the stay went off without a hitch!  Thanks!

Our experience with Susan and Anthony was great!  The guest house was lovely.  We slept well and enjoyed quiet time reading and relaxing on our own little patio.  We look forward to staying with them again on our return to Austin.
listing_name: Tarrytown Apt - just West of DT!

comments:
