Great location plenty of room for 4 or more people.  Thanks!
Had a great time. Private and cozy. Couldn't have asked for more. Thanks Lois!

We had a very comfortable  and happy stay - for a month- in this flat.  It is  well furnished with all the accessories and equipment needed to make it a home away from home.  Kevin was always available and helpful and made the entire experience warm and welcoming.  The location is extremely convenient to UT Austin and within walking distance of good restaurants and coffee shops.  In addition  the flat is beautifully decorated and filled with good books and tasteful art.  Charming and warm and perfect for us. Marg and Arlen

We've stayed here before and really enjoy it. It's very close to Hyde Park shops and restaurants Upper Boggy Creek cafes and a few minutes (sans traffic) to East Austin South Congress 6th street.

charming quiet spot and you can walk in the morning to Cherrytree Coffee shop! We will be back again!

The condo is located in a quiet and friendly complex that is convenient to attractions in central Austin by bicycle or bus.  It is close to Barton Springs an outdoor year round swimming pool fed by a natural spring. A very good vegetarian restaurant is a short walk away.

The inside of the condo was organized for guests with computer and speaker hook ups easily accessible; local maps for touring; and a supply of coffee tea bottled water and other staples for use. Our hostess Lisa was responsive to our needs when we called her with questions.

Scott's place is the perfect Austin pad. It's on a quiet street just east of downtown and central to everything. The first thing that greets you is a big shady porch and the house itself is super clean modern well-appointed and Austin cool. Way more space + amenities than you'd ever find at a hotel for 4X the price and even more relaxing / fun. Also doesn't hurt that Scott's an awesome guy who goes out of his way to make sure your stay is a good one. Really happy with our stay.
listing_name: Fun East Austin Home for ACL SXSW!

comments: This was a great place to stay! Convenient location to the downtown nightlife and all of South Austin festivities. I was able to take all of the back roads through downtown from this place. Dan was a great host at all times it felt like he was just a phone call away! The best part of this rental was the bathroom the shower was awesome! I would definitely stay here again.

Dan was a great host! He had fresh-baked cookies waiting on my arrival as well as other goodies including tea and coffee. The apartment is so quiet and comfortable. I had a wonderful stay. The back deck is wonderful for morning coffee or an evening beer and Dan's sweet little dogs were very friendly and liked to come say hi when they saw me. Loved the sky-lights and appreciated the private entrance. The location was fantastic for me - a calm residential area close to all the parts of South Austin and Zilker that I love. I would be happy to rent from Mr. Dan again.
Nice home in a great location!  Would stay there again.
listing_name: FAB 2 bDR where Airbnb CEO stays!

comments: Our stay in Austin was great! Sovay's place was very convenient to downtown and very easy to find.  Parking was no problem.  The house was lovely and very private.  She made it feel very homey!  Would definitely recommend staying here to anyone!
Great little private apartment so we really felt like it was our own space. Easy walking distance to stuff on South Congress Avenue and good bus links to downtown.

Susan was very pleasant to work with instructions on checking in/out were clear and easy to understand.  Her house is in a great location near the popular and trendy SoCo area and a quick ride to downtown.  The house has all the comforts of home comfortable real beds clean towels cable fans in every room clean modern kitchen stereo etc.  The only draw back may be that it's located near train tracks and while we were there the train passed several times and in the early morning.  The house is so nice and in a great location the train wouldn't keep us from renting again.  Thank you Susan!

This house is in one of the most desireable neighborhoods in Austin within walking distance to Soco and not far from downtown. The house is very cute and cozy and they keep it really neat. I would recommend this place for any one traveling to  Austin especially for us traveling with a pet there was a small back area for pets to run around in.  This was perfect for our group of 5 there were 2 beds in one room a queen/king in the master and a futon in the open area back room. I would stay here again!

Returning to Austin was great fun made all the better due to the wonderful accommodations and Andy and Ellen's hospitality.  The place was as another reviewer put it clean cozy and comfortable and accurately represented here on airbnb.  The kitchen was stocked not only with a diverse mix of breakfast and snack foods including all kinds of beverages but quality HEALTHY stuff (organic wholesome) which was a huge plus for us.  The rooms were spotless and well maintained and we had access to a w/d.  We were afforded considerable privacy -- able to come and go without disturbing anyone and vice versa (yes the dogs barked a few times over the course of a week but not odd hours and it was no bother to us).  The cottage was filled with unique and quirky books mementos and knickknacks -- so perfectly Austin.  Having lived in the neighborhood previously we knew going in it was safe peaceful and strategically well situatiated -- super easy for jumping onto Mopac (10 min to downtown sans traffic) and close proximity to places like Russels Kirby Lane Draught House Taco Deli Houndstooth etc. Overall the experience worked out great for us and we heartily recommend this Central Cottage.

We arrived in Austin for a weekend wedding and were delighted with Kelly's lodgings. The place had everything we could possibly need and was spotlessly clean--better than a luxury hotel. The bed was comfortable (the pullout sofa probably less so--but our preschooler had no complaints) the decorations were tasteful and we felt as if we were in a little private aerie. Kelly even helped us find a wonderful sitter so we could enjoy an evening out. I would stay there again without hesitation.
Dhoi was a great host very accommodating and understanding.

Dolina her husband her child and the dog are perfect hosts the casita is just lovely and beautiful (I could have stayed forever) and nicely located. A perfect stay perfect hosts we will definitely come back!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: The host canceled my reservation the day before arrival.
listing_name: South Austin Aptmnt Room for rent

comments: Staying in Jaimie and Mike's guest house was absolutely perfect for me!  It's a cute house with everything I needed.  The location was good - I rented a bike for the weekend and had no trouble getting everywhere I wanted to go.  Jamie and Mike were very friendly and helpful both before and during my stay.  I'd definitely recommend staying with them and I will again if I'm lucky enough to make it back to Austin!
Absolutely amazing experience! Very clean & comfortable.
Aw thanks David & Julia! We had a GREAT time in Austin. We loved your place and your hospitality was amazing. Hope to cross paths again. All the best Julie & Max
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: This is a lovely spot very well-located in a charming and interesting part of Austin. The hosts are very attentive but not intrusive. The studio apartment is nicely furnished and has everything you need for a short or long stay. Exceptionally clean and comfortable. You can't do wrong with this place!
Wonderful apartment. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here & would recommend it to anyone visiting the area.
Another wonderful stay at Sovay's. Enjoyed the experience as always! Great host great location beautiful house great value.
Condo is in a fantastic location clean and accurately represented in the photos. Angele is wonderful. We were very comfortable and truly enjoyed our stay!

Mary is a great host with a fabulous property. The cottage was spotless when I arrived and everything was in great shape. There were also a lot of nice small touches throughout: tons of towels a few things for breakfast basic kitchen cookware and a selection of DVDs. There's a private outdoor space and the back and front yards are fenced in and you're close to all kinds of great shops and restaurants but still have the feel of a small neighborhood. I stayed there with four adults and one 7-month-old and it was the perfect size for us. We really enjoyed staying there and it will be at the top of my list the next time i'm in Austin. If you are thinking of renting this cottage -- do it!
David was very pleasant and easygoing place was clean stocked with beer and right down on the lake.  Great base to explore the city and keep your privacy intact
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: I lloved Lois's place.  Vibrant colors clear instructions a very welcoming vibe.  The location is great- " close enough but not too close."  You are in a quiet charming neighborhood but have quick access to Lamar.

Belle is incredibly sweet and accommodating. This beautiful guest house was exactly what my girlfriend and I needed for the week we were in Austin. The backyard is exquisitely peaceful and quiet and the home-y feel of the garden and chickens was a fun touch. I'd stay here again in a jiffy.

Staying at Dolina's casita is like being in an enchanted forest it's a beautiful nook with high ceilings  surrounded by trees. Inside is very comfortable and I loved every second that I inhabited it's walls! This is a great place to stay in Austin; convenient comfortable and welcoming. Dolina and her family were kind and considerate I would recommend this place four times over.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Courtney and Joep were wonderful hosts. The room was clean and pretty the house was cool.

Our first airbnb experience.  Viviane and Michael were very welcoming and had great information for us.  The room was outstanding with all of the little touches that showed they cared about their guests.  When was the last time you had cheese cake made for you when you returned from dinner?  Breakfast was terrific and the conversations were lively and exciting.  If we're ever back in Austin this will be where we will stay.  Ohio couple.
Edie was a very welcoming. My friends and I had a very pleasant stay. She did an excellent hosting job. The  bungalow was absolutely adorable! I would highly recommend this place.

This was my first airbnb experience and it was a great one. The place is adorable in a great location (near ut campus) and Kevin & Bob are sweethearts. Kevin even gave us a ride when our cab never showed. I highly recommend this place.
Sara and her husband Travis were excellent hosts! We loved our stay and the cottage is perfect and cozy and close to everything we wanted to do. Great place to stay!!!
Jenny's house was excellent for our stay.  The house was convenient and worked out great for the 4 couples.    We really enjoyed our trip!!

I reserved the Soco Room at the CinnaMan villa by posting onto the AirBNB waitlist for Austin from my mobile phone while driving down from Dallas. Viviane responded promptly and confirmed while I was still en route. Her home is a large villa located conveniently close to Congress street (with the food trucks) and the bridge by the Capitol. 

I really liked our room - it was cosy clean and sports a cute balcony that opens out onto the yard. Viviane's living room is stacked with comicbooks nice loungy chairs and she is usually around to let you in and is a really personable friendly and caring host. I enjoyed chatting with her an Michael and chilling in the house when I wasn't out and about in Austin. I will definitely be back !
Could not have been an easier or better stay. Accommodations were clean and comfortable everything I could possibly need was provided and the location was great.
The house is in a great location and Katherine was extremely helpful and accommodating.  We would definitely rent from her again.

We had a very nice time and were very pleased with how clean cozy and cute the cottage was.  The fridge was well-stocked the kitchen had everything we needed and the neighborhood was quiet and pretty. It was perfect for a weekend getaway.
Cool place. The real Austin experience. Marcus was easy-going and a great host.  Can't wait to go back.

Great condo close to everything.  There is no check-in or check-out which makes it nice if you are arriving and leaving at odd times to get the key and return it.  Quiet neighborhood quiet complex.  I highly recommend it!  Angele is a great hostess.

What a wonderful experience!  Belle's place is amazing!  The craftsmanship on the building is first rate totally "green"  very tastefully furnished and we had everything we needed.  The bed was like sleeping on a cloud the smell of cedar was heavenly; everything was very clean and neat as a pin--with a delightful Austin vibe.  We will be back!
Cute modern and Immculate appartment. Beautiful and safe neighborhood. Convenient to everything the "Live Music Capitol of the World" has to offer. Kelli and Louie are the perfect hosts.

Courtney and Steven were so hospitable on such short notice i literally booked the house the night before i arrived in town! I had a wonderful time staying in their little love nest. The house is decorated so sweet nice personal touches with a spacious backyard and it was very clean even though they had been out of town without expecting anyone to visit. The beds were comfortable the restroom is well lit and has an awesome shower head oh and the kitchen isn't just for looks it a has everything you need! The house isn't located in downtown Austin but it has very easy access that will get you there depending on where in about 15-25 minutes. It is super close (walking distance) to Highland Mall and other good places for shopping and eating. I was lucky enough to meet the kind couple when leaving thank you so much again for letting us leave our bags till after the festival and for a nice stay at such a delightful home!

What a great apartment! Bill and Melissa work hard to keep that place clean and make sure their customers are happy. When I forgot my shampoo and conditioner I was able to find some under the sink. Love the extra effort!

Kristi's place is cute comfortable and welcoming.  I would have given it 5 stars but the location wasn't in the coolest part of town as her tagline indicated.  It is quite residential but is accessible to the downtown area via a bus that comes every 45 minutes or so.  

Thanks Kristi for a great place to stay!
listing_name: Cute Condo in Coolest Part of Town!

comments: Great experience would recommend to anyone looking for a great place to stay at a good price. We never heard noise nor were disturbed during our stay. Thanks again!
Lisa had a great place! She even had an air mattress made up for my extra friends upon arrival. Close to everything we had a great time. Walk to El Meson on S. Lamar for some awesome breakfast!
Thanks so much for having us! We had a fantastic stay and the place had everything we needed! We'll definitely hit you up next time we're in town!

Dan is a great guy! Not only was his room just what I needed in a great part of town but Dan is a solid guy with an open mind and kind heart who has a cool house and a super friendly dog. Initially I arrived at his house after a nightmare experience elsewhere in town. This place hit the spot and I ended up staying a bit longer and making friends with Dan. Great part of town too! I managed pretty well there without a car!

I really enjoyed my stay at the Lotus House. Alyson is a fantastic host and I felt very much at home during my time there. Both home and host were  warm and inviting; I really appreciated Alyson's knowledge and great leads on various restaurants neighborhoods and places to visit during my stay. The Lotus House is located in a quiet neighborhood but very convenient to South Congress and some of the best areas in town and a short bike ride to downtown. It was great to be able to borrow a bike during my stay. I will definitely stay here again when next in Austin and highly recommend Lotus House and Alyson to anyone visiting the city.

Susan's South Austin home was in an eclectic neighborhood. It was fun walking through it to the festival. The house was neat and clean with an amazing kitchen/entertaining area. I loved looking out the back windows to bamboo; it was like I was in a tree house. Our stay was comfortable. Susan was accommodating with our arrival/ departure time and kept in communication with us if we needed anything.  

I really shouldn't say all of this because I would rather it be available for me and my friends only*.

Lester is a very nice guy.  He made sure that I had everything I needed went out of his way to offer little bits and pieces of extra help and all in all a great host.  The place is cozy and in a great location plus the bed was super comfy almost made it hard to get up and do anything!  Highly recommended!
listing_name: SOCO One private room in a 2B house

comments: Sylvia has a very nice BnB which my wife Sharon and I used as our base to explore Austin. No need for a car it's a easy walk to all restaurants and bars. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Oh the dogs were great aswell.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: Elizabeth and James were super nice - laid out an extra mattress for us let me back into the house to grab something I'd forgotten a good two hours after we'd checked out ; great communication; comfortable digs in a great part of Austin; AND only a block and a half from Mr. Natural an authentic all-vegan Mexican restaurant and health food store I always try to make a pilgrimage to when I'm in town anyway so... bonus!
listing_name: Hip Downtown East House with Bikes!

comments:
The location is quiet but also close to downtown Austin. It's also quite close to a bus stop which makes it easy to go downtown as well. The location is walking distance to Zilker Park and also close to the US-1 on-ramp if you are going to be visiting north or south of downtown Austin. 

They also have WIFI a spacious living room and a desk for working. Also Dhoi and her husband were very friendly and accommodating. I enjoyed my stay.

Tyler was a great host. We were out and about mostly at a football game and music festival but Tyler kept in touch via text to make sure we had everything we needed. His place is pretty conveniently located and a very short bus ride to the best parts of Austin. When I come back to Austin (hopefully soon) I'll definitely try to stay with him again.
listing_name: South Austin Aptmnt Room for rent

comments: This was my first time using Air BnB and I couldn't be happier. The condo was in a perfect location near downtown Austin but just far enough away to stay nice and quiet. The condo was clean well stocked and had everything we needed. Check in and out was super easy the owners were friendly and very easy to work with. I'm sure I'll be staying here again on my next trip.
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: Scott's house was GREAT! - felt like we were at home the whole time. The house was very clean and had everything one would need and the porch was very relaxing! close to everything. thanks scott!!
listing_name: Fun East Austin Home for ACL SXSW!

comments: My boyfriend and I stayed for five nights. It's an adorable place and David made it a great experience. Highly recommended!

The little cottage was great! Super comfortable incredibly clean perfect size for two people. The location worked really well too. Walking distance to South Congress shops & restaurants easy bus routes a block away less then $10 cab fare to get downtown.  Really liked the Crowbar pub and taco truck at the end of the block too! We would stay here again.

This little cottage is amazing!  We pulled up and were greeted by smiling kids swinging from the trees with bunny rabbits hopping around their feet!  The place was perfect homy and in a great location! I caught myself telling people it was where we were "living" that weekend.  I will be back soon for sure!!

Great space with plenty of privacy! We were on our honeymoon and it was our first trip to Austin so it was nice to have a quiet spot to relax. The apartment itself is great and has all the amenities you would expect and more! Michael stocked the fridge with a few beers a bottle of wine and local organic goodies. The place is incredibly close to all the bars/restaurants/boutiques that South Congress is known for and we enjoyed every minute. We are dog people and Sophie quickly became our best friend - she is a sweet heart!

My friend and I stayed in Austin for the Funfunfun Fest and Boy it was fun!    Austin is amazing. Fiona's cottage was just what we were looking for.   It was clean and quite cheerful.  The walls are all a different bright color making it impossible to wake up on the wrong side of the bed.  Fiona was also very quick to respond to my e-mails and greeted us right when we arrived.  She was a great host.  The cottage is also in a good neighborhood and is pretty close to 6th street where all the nightlife is.  All and all a great trip.

This was our first trip to Austin and the location was extremely convenient.  Sara had just gotten back into the country and had the cottage in tip-top shape for us.  It was quiet comfortable and very clean.  Sara and her husband have thought of everything -- from the real milk and OJ in the fridge to the fluffy towels and  great shower.  This was also our first experience with Airbnb and it couldn't have been a better all-around experience.
Rich & Sharon Boulder Colorado

Angele was easy to reach quick to respond and the condo was perfect--exactly as pictured and described. The whole thing experience was smooth and easy and our stay was great. Would definitely stay here again!

I second all the positive reviews. I spent two weeks in Drew and Simone's Hyde Park apartment and had a wonderful experience. It was the perfect mix of privacy and host-guest congeniality. The apartment is beautiful and much more spacious than it appears in the photos. The neighborhood is lovely and so are the hosts. Look no further!

The bungalow is fab - so clean light airy and spacious!  I only wish I'd been able to spend more time there.  Sovay left all sorts of goodies in the kitchen and especially the bathroom - I've never seen such a well-stocked bathroom in a rental!  I had fun trying out the various unguents...  There's a huge TV the AC heats as well as cools (necessary for chilly nights). and the wi-fi is really easy to access.

Sovay herself is charm personified and she provided a long list of recommendations for things to do and see in Austin.

I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the SOCO It-Z bit-Z Bungalow.

The place was a great space to come back to after long days of helping out with my friend's wedding prep. The kitchen was impressively stocked and helped me and my boyfriend feel right at home.
The price really was a good deal and I loved the neighborhood. Walking to Kerby Lane Diner was also a treat.
I highly recommend staying at Andy's cottage!

This is an adorable unit in one of Austin's prettiest neighborhoods. One bedroom is in a mini-loft/attic above the living area and the other is in the back by the kitchen so my roommate and I had a lot of space and privacy. The house is well-furnished with everything you could possibly need for a home away from home experience. Pete is a wonderful host quick to respond to any of our queries prior to our stay and I also liked that he lives just a few houses away from this unit in case we needed to reach him for any issues. Fortunately there were none! I'd definitely book this home again on my next visit to Austin!
listing_name: Historic Hyde Park Home By Downtown

comments: Staying at Courtney's was my first experience using AirBnB - It was a bittersweet. On the one hand as a mother of 2 young children the comfort of staying in a home was great - kitchen available and separate rooms for the kids. The decoration of the place was nice and quirky. But upon further inspection I noticed that there was dog hair "everywhere" - not just the floors but the sofas toilet seat pots/pans etc. This is no exaggeration. In the morning I made omeletes and there was dog hair there too. I knew she had a dog but was assured that the place would be cleaned up for the night I was staying. To top it all off they left the dishwasher full of dirty dishes - apparently so we could put our own dirty dishes in as well and wash them together. Unfortunately it was almost full and there wasn't sufficient silverware for us so we had to wash dishes by hand. Also the kitchen trash was half full. Courtney said in the rush to give us the apartment 2 hours early she forgot to take it out. I can see how that could happen but the combination of all the other things - the general lack of cleanliness - really left me unsatisfied with my stay. It was a real shame because other than that which is a big deal her house was nice. Still at more than $100 dollars a night I expect at least a certain level of cleanliness - dog or no dog. If she isn't into cleaning then at least they can splurge for a cleaning lady before having (website hidden) I'm not an OCD clean freak I have pictures of the clumps of dog hair around everywhere.

I rented Edie's Bungalow for my parents while they were in town. They are from a small country town so when I told them where they would be staying they seemed a little apprehensive. That changed the moment we arrived and were met with Edie's amazing welcoming smile.  Her home and the bungalow in her back yard were beautifully restored and very comfortable. Everything was clean and well thought out. My parents loved the entire experience and have sworn off hotel stays from now on.  They said over and over how they would like to stay with Edie again next time they're in Austin. This was a perfect experience! Thanks Edie !

I loved this place! So cozy and sweet and a great location to boot. Lois was a delight! She helped me find all kinds of fun things to do and if it weren't for her recommendation I would have never found the Gospel Brunch that was one of the highlights of my trip. When in Austin next I'll definitely be back here!

Great upstairs apartment! Comfy master bed and loved the sun porch attached to the living room. Kitchen in well equipped for making meals and there are also lots of great spot nearby. Kevin will help you out if you need help finding anything as well.

Matt is a wonderful host and if you plan in advance for a fee he will pick you up at the airport!  I was in Austin for a conference and didn't have to rent a car. I just took a taxi to downtown and it was less than 10.00 each way.  He is a down to earth genuinely nice person.  He has traveled extensively and he is interesting to talk to.  His place is so convenient to everything South Congress!  I recommend staying at his place.
listing_name: A Baby suite on SoCo in room bath

comments: Great place!!! Cool area totally smooth experience. Would do again!

Wow! I cannot say enough about this place - it is more beautiful than can be captured in pictures.  Every space in this house has a unique feel and creative vibe.  My friends and I appreciated the attention to detail - there are some thoughtful features including plush rugs comfortable and oh so soft sheets such comfortable beds thick delicious-smelling towels luxury shampoos and other bathroom amenities even mixers for drinks and snacks too!  Lyon was so easy to work with - and responded very quickly to all of my questions and requests.  I appreciated his recommendations for near-by restaurants and his update about events that were happening during our visit.  At the end of each day of our visit to Austin my friends and I were just excited to get back to "our" gorgeous spacious house for the evening! This is a wonderful space - I cannot recommend it enough.  Stay here and you will not be disappointed.
listing_name: Circa 1899 Luxe Spa House - Walk DT

comments: My friends and I had a great experience in Susan's house while we were in Austin for a wedding.  This was our first time doing a site like AirBnB and we had a wonderful time.  The house was clean accessible and very homey.  Susan's home is in a great friendly neighborhood with plenty of amenities around.  Though we never actually met Susan she made it know that she was available with problems at any time.
What an awesome place! Very clean cozy and quiet! I very much enjoyed and appreciated my stay!

Big n' cozy is an understatement! This one bedroom is HUGE! And it's the sweetest most quaint apartment I've ever stayed in. I walked in and immediately felt like I was in a best friends home. Beautiful pictures and antiques. It had so much character and energy. Ashley is very loved as proven by the amazing letters that she has received and so proudly displayed. :)
Ashley was incredibly hospitable even without her being there! She sent check up texts to make sure everything was going smoothly. The location of Ashley's apartment is ideal! Walking distance to a few incredible restaurants and convenience stores. Minutes from downtown.
I had such a memorable time staying at Ashley's home. I will never forget it.

Wow!  That's the greatest compliment I could give.  I've stayed in some really nice hotels before but I can honestly say that this was the BEST place I've stayed in.  Kelly was so accommodating and friendly that I'm sure she could very well open her own hotel and be very successful at it.  She had a stocked fridge tools to cook with supplies to clean with...I don't think I could have wanted or needed anything else. 

The pictures don't do this place justice.  I felt like I just stepped into an Ikea catalog and I love love love Ikea. I traveled with my partner's mom who can be very picky at times and she absolutely had nothing remotely negative to say about this place.  She felt safe comfortable and kept commenting on how great of a deal we got with this place.  

Now I know where to stay in Austin when I visit :)

Tyler was a fantastic host. We really enjoyed our stay at Austin. The place was clean and well kept. It is also at a great location - walking distance to some of the best shops and restaurants the city has to offer. 
Tyler went out of his way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. He volunteered to be our personal chaperone for a day took us to the city's best look out spot on a mountain and then drove us to some of the city's most famous bars and shows. 
I would definitely recommend anyone who wants to have a good time in Austin to stay at Tyler's house.
listing_name: South Austin Aptmnt Room for rent

comments:
We booked this apartment last minute and Lisa responded so fast. Condo was exactly as described and her place is fantastic. Lisa left us a bottle of wine upon arrival and fresh flowers in the bathroom. :)
We have since become friends on facebook! Thanks for a wonderful experience and we look forward to staying at your place in the near future!
Thanks so much!
Cindy

Had a wonderful stay at Belle's place.  My husband and I as well as our teenage son spent 4 nights here in mid November.  The accommodations were most comfortable!  We also enjoyed being able to sleep with windows open at night in the quiet neighborhood.   Lots of space on both floors made our stay enjoyable as well.   Belle was a fabulous host and made sure we were comfortable throughout our stay.   We look forward to a return visit in the not too distant future and would highly recommend to others.
It was surpisingly and welcomingly quiet at night close to South Congress area and downtown and the price reasonable.

Super hostess and a great place to stay! It was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The location was excellent - close to everything we needed. We will definitely stay again next time we are in Austin;)

i stayed with Tammy for a week while visiting my family. She has a peaceful place in a quiet location away from the business of the traffic. i have slept very well in her bed the bathroom is handy and  i am enjoying it so much that i've made plans to return...

Michael and Stephanie's place was perfect for our 3-night stay in Austin. The apartment was bright comfortable and well-appointed. I loved being able to open the windows and feel the cross-breeze. The location just a block away from South Congress could not have been better and we were able to explore the neighborhood a lot on foot (though we could have also borrowed bikes which was a great offer). Michael was helpful in providing recommendations of places to eat and things to do. I would highly recommend staying here.
Charming house in a great location. Mary was wonderful and easy to connect with. Can't wait to book again.

What a quaint home and location.  Our first visit to Austin and to see our daughter and husband's new hometown brought us to this lodging.  Brewed coffee greeted us each morning.  We had brought items for breakfast and the refrigerator was a great bonus.  The location - in SoCo area was perfect not only for our family visit but to also see Austin and the surrounding hill country.  The space in the Zilker suite was perfect: bedroom closet bath w/tub and shower kitchen privileges and a great table to use for eating or a work desk etc...  The on street parking we safe and well lit.  This can be the perfect place to call "home in Austin."

We loved staying at the cottage!  Andy and Ellen were so nice and the cottage was adorable.  We loved having access to the bikes - we were able to ride downtown on the Shoal Creek trail and it was nice staying in walking distance of Central Market.  We would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for wonderful accommodations in Austin.  I hope to come back and stay at the cottage for SXSW!
I had a wonderful stay at Verde Camp for a work trip. Place was very clean & comfortable and in a great location. I will definitely be staying here again when I'm in Austin.

I booked a stay at the Zilker Suite while on a business trip from Oregon.  Her place is very close to downtown extremely clean and I had everything I needed.  I would recommend it to anyone wanting a superior option to a hotel!

Marcus could have been an anonymous landlord but instead chose to be a warm welcoming host.  He stayed in touch through texting and made me feel comfortable about making requests.  He even helped with a last minute project for my son's school.
The place was clean comfy and spacious.  Great location.  Great communication with the host and I can't imagine a more seamless experience.  Highly recommend this place!!!

My stay at the Cozy Casita was fine. The hosts very friendly and the space  is lovely. Unfortunately I didn't spend much time there as I was at a conference but if I were to return to Austin for pure fun I would definitely book the same place. Given its distance from downtown having a car might be handy although the bus is close by and cheap.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Austin was Fantastic. Lois's Peaceful Haven was the perfect place to stay. it was everything it says it is fun funky and peaceful. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.
very very nice

Ashley was friendly and gracious.  She extended herself in making sure we had a great time in Austin.
Her place was lovely with a comfy atmosphere and a great back porch.  If I'm ever in Austin again I'd definitely want to stay at her place.
listing_name: FAB 2 bDR where Airbnb CEO stays!

comments: Matt was an excellent host. Very kind and generous . His house is super cool and it's located near all the yummy restaurants and shops on S. Congress. We walked everywhere .. My husband and I fell in love with his dog Crystal. One of the sweetest dogs we've ever met! We really wish we could've sat and talked with Matt more about his adventures around parts of the world.. He has a great taste for style as youll notice. We'll definitely stay at Matt's again.  Thanks Matt!
listing_name: A Baby suite on SoCo in room bath

comments: My wife and I had a great stay here.  The place is incredibly charming and in a great location within walking distance of all the shops/restaurants in SoCo.  We loved the entire SoCo area and it was great to be right in the middle of it.  This was our first Airbnb experience and it couldn't have been better.

The bungalow was great!  Clean quaint centrally located and near public transportation. I didn't use the kitchen but if someone wanted to it is perfect. Extremely quiet and hassle free. Andy had stocked he fridge with more than enough food which was an awesome surprise. Simply perfect. They even offered me a ride which was above and beyond anything I expected.  Stay here if you are looking for a great neighborhood and don't need to be stuck downtown. Hike and bike nearby. Bikes available. I will be back!

The Clarksville Condo was perfect for us during our stay.  Great location for our training downtown a beautiful apartment nicely decorated a quiet and clean space.  It had everything we needed even coffee in the freezer to brew and organic sugar in the pantry.  Fresh towels comfortable bed very functional too with the washer/dryer and full kitchen with appliances.  Our host Angele was also very responsive to any questions we had.  We will definitely be staying again!

This is a gorgeous house. spotless and completely stocked. The neighborhood is beautiful with deer all over the place. We enjoyed our stay so much. Super recommended. Thanks Robbie for being such a wonderful host.

Tammy was a fantastic host! As it was my first time in Austin She was very helpful in explaining the area she even gave me a list of suggestions that I can't wait to check out! Her place is quite simply magical and her precious dog Scout was enjoyable to have around! I was very comfortable during my stay it was a pleasant experience for my arrival in a new city.

The cottage is adorable and Joe and his wife were wonderful communicative hosts. Upon my arrival I received a call to make sure everything was in order and to call if I needed anything at all. I had a very relaxing productive time there. And the location is great S Congress has so many places to eat shop and play. Excellent value all around!

I recently stayed for a week at this wonderful little guest house in East Austin.  It is in a very quiet neighborhood and it was a great experience.  The interior is very unique with a lot of red cedar trim including a vaulted mitered ceiling in the upstairs bedroom.  It was very clean and comfortable.  I got so much rest!  Belle was most accommodating as I brought two cats with large kennels and she and her family helped me carry them in and out.  In addition I arrived rather late the first night and she brought me fresh fruit and brownies so that I didn't have to go back out for food.  The muffins the last morning were great too.  Overall it was a very pleasant stay and I hope to go back again someday.  Belle is a great host and made me feel very welcome and comfortable.

You will love this location. There is not a better choice in Austin as far as I am concerned. All that you require to survive and thrive is within walking distance grocery stores shopping fantastic restaurants etc. Your hosts are friendly giving and flexible. Get ready to play ball with Sophie the most social of their three pups. 
Book with supreme confidence!!
This was the first time my husband and I stayed at this location. It was very comfortable spacious clean and chic. Sovay's attention to detail is astonishing. Highly recommend.

My family and I could not have asked for a more comfortable or lovely place to stay! Kelly's little "home away from home" has charm warmth and all the comforts you'd expect. In a quiet and beautiful section of Old Austin it was easy to relax and rejuvenate after a long and busy day. Kelly and her husband were very welcoming and always there if needed but sensitive to our privacy. I would highly recommend staying with Kelly if you are visiting the Austin area. We truly had a perfect visit!
Very green very clean very quiet.  The available breakfast was a nice plus over what I was expecting of an extra bedroom in their home.

Great house in Austin! 
Me and my 2 friends had a great time there. Plenty of room newly furnished very good washer and dryer and the best equipped kitchen I had seen in a while!
Easy $9 cab to 6th street if you want to head out at night but plently to do just around the corner. 
Easy check in with no hassles!
I would definitely stay there again if I was in Austin

Joe and his right hand woman Juanita were absolutely amazing! I was pleasantly surprised from the minute I arrived to the day of my departure.  All three of the cottages are beautifully decorated and completely functional.  They have truly mastered the art of service/experience designƒ??ƒ??they completely ensured a seamless and enjoyable experience from the beginning to the end.  The location is second to none in the heart of the famous Austin SOCO district. It goes without saying that I highly recommend!!

The Cozy Casita is perfect for a solitary retreat a couple's getaway or as a peaceful home base for a small family's adventures in Austin. Great convenient location in South Austin. Easy to get to all the great places Austin has to offer! Dolina and family are very gracious thoughtful and accommodating hosts. We look forward to visiting The Birdhouse again next year!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: We recently stayed at Belle's guest house for thanksgiving.We had a great time in Austin and knowning that we had plenty of space in the guest house made the trip so much better. It was really great with the chicken coop right next door it made the whole trip so much better for my toddler (website hidden) is located in a nice area of austin with lots to do not far away.

The Zilker Park B & B is a beautiful spot to spend a couple of days relaxing whilst you explore Austin. Youth and flexibility would be an advantage as all seating is on the ground. The futon beds were comfortable and the many cushions and pillows fun.
As Lois stated the shower is petite - be prepared!
Overall though it is good value for money in a fascinating part of Austin within a peaceful neighbourhood.
My parents enjoyed staying at the condo.  Great central Austin location and lots of info on what to do in town etc.
From the moment we opened to door everything was wonderful. It is as nice as any 4 star hotel with all the amenities you could need.  We had a great time and look forward to returning.

Elizabeth and David are wonderful hosts.  They are so kind and so much fun.  We stayed with them when we first moved to Austin and searched for an apartment.   They were very helpful with advice on the area and told us about a lot of cool things around the city.  It was nice to arrive here knowing no one at at all and have people like them welcome us to Austin.  Our stay made us very comfortable here right away and we'll definitely be keeping in touch with Elizabeth and David.
Super cozy. Great area we walked to Bennu's for coffee and tacos' every morning. Perfect getaway!

Adorable private cottage in a really convenient location. Sara's directions were great - we never met her (unfortunately) but she anticipated everything and the trip went without a hitch. The space was clean as a whistle and the bed was comfy. We would absolutely stay here again and will recommend the place to (website hidden). Don't worry if you leave your book at home like I did. Sara's collection is drool-worthy.

We stayed there after our wedding and were very happy. The hosts were very friendly and warm. The space has very nice high ceilings and a clean Asian design sensibility. The details are great: coffee tv candles soaps etc.  The location is walkable to the lake coffee and restaurants. The hosts offered to let us use their bikes and even offered to let us use their kitchen. The neighborhood is quiet lovely and convenient.
listing_name: Tarrytown Apt - just West of DT!

comments: Matt was a super cool relaxed host-totally no hassle.  The home was absolutely beautiful and well appointed.  It is located in a quite and safe neighborhood just seconds from the heart of SOCO downtown Austin and Domain. Recommend!
listing_name: A Baby suite on SoCo in room bath

comments:
Enjoyed the say Sovay was a great host too!

The place is quite close to Austin downtown the 'vintage' piano in the living room looks awesome!

Very cute thoughtfully appointed studio. Sovay was so nice - upon request she provided a pack 'n' play for our baby daughter to sleep in..and the closet was big enough (with some shelves removed) to turn into a mini baby room! Highly recommended!!
We had a fantastic visit to Austin.  Cathryn's place is perfectly located and she is a great host.  Thanks for taking the time to make sure our stay was perfect.  Definitely will be using her again!

That was my first time in Texas and It turned out that my choice was correct!  The host is fun helpful and knowledgible. The place is clean spacious and beatiful. More than this I really like the taste of her place  and on my way back at the local store I bought the same carpet the same as hers!! ---- bring back a warm piece of TX!

We had positive experience staying at David's condo in Austin. Our hosts were accomodating friendly and offered some extras like bottled water in the fridge... The condo is in an excellent location: next to a large park along the lake and close to Congress Ave leading to downtown. Five min away from our door were excellent restaraunts great music venues and the lakeshore trail! I recommend this property highly...
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments: Amazing house with a great deck in the back. The front patio is very relaxing as well and has a nice vibe at night. Close to downtown and the hipsters
listing_name: Fun East Austin Home for ACL SXSW!

comments: It's really a nice house clean and comfortable. It is just like our own home and we have a good time!

my husband and i had a wonderful and peaceful time staying at the aerie house. i LOVED the comfort of the bed. the peacefulness of the house. and also being surrounded by the trees at night it was so tranquil. we loved the simplicity of the house and belle accommodated our every need even while she was out of town. 
we loved marta the dog. and the chicken coop was so great too. the location of the house was PERFECT to every part of austin in getting around. i will be back for sure. 
and there were TWO a/c units in the home which is a plus for me. and again the bed was super comfy. great water pressure too.

Lisa and I enjoyed our stay with Lois very much. Austin is a very enjoyable city to spend a few days and Lois' home fits the theme of friendly quirky and peaceful. The space is colourful bright and quiet in a pleasant neighbourhood yet only five minutes' drive from downtown.

The space is separate from the main house ensuring plenty of privacy with its own small but very comfortable and clean bathroom. They were chilly mornings when we were there but there was plenty of bedding and heating to ensure the space was cosy.

Lois responded to our last minute request for accommodation immediately so we had no concerns about not having a place to stay for the night.

Lois is generous with information about Austin a city she loves very much. Her recommendations about places to eat and visit were top-notch and we would happily stay with her again.

We stayed at this well-equipped studio three weeks and had a pleasant stay. Karen was very nice and went out of her way to be helpful. The studio is especially enjoyable when the weather is nice because then you can enjoy the huge wild garden right in front of it. A potentually difficult point is that you can't fully control the heating/aircon by yourself because this is done by the renters upstairs.
Great place with lot's of unique touches. Super cozy!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Nice house in a lovely neighborhood. Bed was super comfy and the hosts were excellent. Lots of space and very handy on site laundry. Close to Central Market.

Michele was a great host! I am returning to Austin after 6 months of traveling and needed a place to stay for a few days of my transition. As soon as I arrived Michele offered to take me grocery shopping which I happily took her up on a few hours later. We not only had several good chats but we're actually going to a concert this Thursday - and I'm not even staying there now :) I couldn't have asked for a more helpful and generous host. From morning coffee to info about the buses Michele is full of information and consideration. I would love to stay here again and plan to keep in touch.

Very nice clean and simple accommodation not too far from downtown and the river in a good neighborhood. Dhoi was nice enough to take me up to campus when I arrived and drop me at the Amtrak station when I left.
A great little place that is well provisioned and well located.  Can't wait to return!!

Beautiful house very comfortable bed location is great.  We only wish we could have visited with our hosts more but there is so much fun to be had in Austin we were out enjoying ourselves. You must walk from the Aerie House to East Side Cafe'.  Not a cafe' at all.  Amazing food and service. Then walk through the huge garden and visit the chickens. There are several great restaurants you could walk to.

first time using airbnb - skeptical at first - very pleasantly surprised - Tammy was having guests over for a party but still offered room on short notice of few hours - super sweet dog Scout politely requesting more attention - and above all a fantastic price

Sovay's "Lovely Bungalow" .. Was A True Gift .. "She Happened To Have A Opening For 4 Night's" .. Exactly When I Needed A Last Minute Break .. "I Needed Some ME Time" .. (She Is Very Booked .. And That Is Well Deserved) .. So "I Felt Lucky To Have Found Such A Wonderful Place" .. "She Is The Perfect Host" .. And Her Sweet Place Is "LightPrettyVery Comfortable( loved the bed )Extra CleanExcellent Central Austin Location .. And A Great Place For People In Town For Business .. The Best Place To Just Get Away By Yourself .. A Very Nice Choice For A Couple .. "I Didn't Want To Leave" .. I Highly Recommend This Fabulous Place .. "I Know I Will Be Returning To Stay" .. And .. "Will Be Telling  Friend's and Family To Enjoy It As Well" .. ( 5 * For Sure ) ! .. Beth Ann
Angele's condo was beautiful clean and a cozy place to stay! I loved feeling like a local in Austin is such a quaint neighborhood so close to all of the action. I definitely recommend this spot.
This was a great place to stay. Very cute. Good for one person or two people that know each other well (no door on the bathroom only a curtain). Fiona was awesome and really helpful!

Andy and Ellen's cottage was a great place to stay.  It felt like home there with all they provided like really healthy foods.  The little details in the cottage are very pleasant and the neighborhood was very peaceful.  I would come back to visit when in Austin.  This beats a hotel anyday!

This was my husband and I's first time using Airbnb so we were a little apprehensive at first. Belle made our stay so enjoyable and even made up the futon for my mom to be able to stay with us. There was a table of water tea and coffee available right when we walked in. The neighbors had started building a garage right next to the Aerie and Belle was kind enough to offer a refund if the noise was unsuitable for us. Fortunately the neighbors agreed to keep the noise down while we were there. It was so comforting to feel like we were taken care of like family while being away from home. Thanks Belle!!

I had a marvelous time staying in this efficiency. Hyde Park is my favorite neighborhood in Austin and this spot was perfectly situated to maximize my time there. The space was very cute and had everything I needed. Marcus was a fantastic host and great with communication. Would definitely stay here again.

Jenny was the perfect hostess. She responded quickly to my initial request maintained steady communication and was just so pleasant to work with. Upon arrival she gave us a thorough tour of her beautiful retreat (even lovelier in person) and even offered her herb garden for our cooking pleasure! The house neighborhood her binder of great tips & recommendations and her professional welcoming demeanor are what make airbnb absolutely worth it.

Ashley's house is the perfect retreat for a visit to Austin.  Just off the beaten path in a cozy neighborhood with lots of cute homes and big tress.   Easy walk downtown with lots of coffee shops and places to eat very close by.   Decor is relaxed and bohemian and back porch is great place to hang out.    
Ashley is an amazing hostess...personable fun and has a very big heart.   She went out of her way to make sure my experience there was a good one.  And she even drove me to airport when my ride fell through.  
 Definitely one of my best all-time BnB experiences.
listing_name: FAB 2 bDR where Airbnb CEO stays!

comments: Great location in South Austin.  Susan was a great host the house was immaculant and the accomadation were comfortable.

We had a wonderful weekend at Belle's Aerie Guest house. The space was quiet  serene and secluded. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice place to stay in Austin. It's close enough to a lot of the east side attractions but far enough for a quiet night's rest. You will not be disappointed if you choose the Aerie!

Kelly was such a pleasure to work with! Not only was she accomodating but such a gracious host. The cottage is just as pictured clean neat and very cozy. My husband son (3) and I enjoyed our stay and couldn't have been more comfortable. 

Kelly was thoughtful and sweet I felt like we were visiting a friend.

THANK YOU Kelly! It was a pleasure and we hope to stay with you again.

Absolutely no complaints from our stay at CinnaMan Villa. Our hosts were very friendly and accommodating for our entire party! Location is fantastic and the house is lovely. Not to mention the cooking was to die for! 
Thanks Viviane for a great stay.

Michael was a great host. We needed a place last-minute in Austin where 3 of us could crash and make the most of a rained-out weekend. Michael basically vacated the place to make space and we moved on in making meals& cookies on a cold night playing games and when the weather cleared a bit walking (20 min) downtown. And thanks for the fresh eggs from your ducks and chickens--nice little urban homestead.
listing_name: Cozy 3 Bedroom In the Heart of ATX

comments: Excellent cottage in the center of everything immaculate well maintained and stocked.  Joe is a gracious and helpful host who made checking in and out a breeze. This location gave me the best of both worlds a feeling of living in a hotel but with all the warmth of staying with a friend.  I could not have been more pleased with the accommodations or the host. Highly recommended!

This is a perfect space - the bungalow is stocked with all the amenities you might need.  Kitchen is fully outfitted and a grocery store is nearby so I could cook. Comfy bed and space for lounging! I'll be back!

Really a great place to stay.  Perfect location - within 3 blocks of SoCo.  Didn't see John but we didn't have the need to seek him out.  We were given our privacy but felt we could knock and chat if we needed to.  Would absolutely without a doubt stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

We had a great time at Belle's. She is an amazing host. I really appreciated the peace and quiet of the Aerie House. We live on a ranch outside of Austin so the Aerie House was a nice place to crash after a day in town. We actually ended up spending the night in the Aerie House is perfect for a rainy night.

I always take a break before the holidays to clear my head and set intentions for the holidays and new year. Usually I drive to Marfa TX but wanted something closer to home (Austin). The place was quiet cozy clean beautiful and had everything I needed. It was a joy to be so close to home and so relaxed at the same time!

We stayed here for a month while on business. Guido was very accommodating to our needs. If we needed anything at all he was more than happy to help us out. The place was wonderful. It had absolutely everything you would need when staying out of town. It was a very short drive to downtown without any heavy traffic. It was a short distance to any shopping or dining without having to sit in traffic. If we are ever in need of a big place for an extended period of time we would definately check with Guido first!

There was an issue with the property I originally booked and Joe offered to move the reservation over to another property (larger & more expensive) he manages at no additional charge to me.

The property was clean and comfortable. Good location. The owner provides a great packet of info on the area and neighborhood as well as Austin in general.

Would definitely stay in properties managed by Joe again.

Thanks for a great place.

I entered the place and actually thought I was in the wrong accommodation. But I couldn't be as I realised I had the key in my hand. A whole cottage to myself. The decor is fab all the facilities and appointments one could desire the location ideal (great neighbourhood) close to downtown and Sovay is a delight - easy to get along with and vibrant conversation. I've been on the road for 9 months and this is the most comfortable I've felt in all the places I've stayed...and some of that has been 5 star. He dad is also great value...we had really good chats. Many thanks Sovay

my husband and I stayed here after a time of being apart for a month...it felt like a little honeymoon suite up in the trees. Very comfortable bed a warm heater and homemade blueberry muffins in the morning...we loved being within an urban farm with chickens and gardens outside...
Perfect little cottage for a place to crash. Owner is very on the spot - quickly brought me a space heater when a norther blew in while staying there. Would stay again.

Angele's place is absolutely perfect! Minutes from downtown is absolutely accurate we walked and when we couldn't there were bus stops literally a minute walk from the apartment.  As well its walking distance from wholefoods (supermarket) and super quiet in a nice and safe area. We loved staying here and If we return to austin this is definitely the place for us! Thanks Angele!

My second stay (this time for ten days!) at this amazing shangri la in Austin this time made all the more memorable by an afternoon tea and cookies with Dolina Yohan and Singh!  Looking forward to my next trip though.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Loved staying there Dan.... Fun with Iris the dog..... I think one or more of Mike's towels got left there adding to the linens for you. Be safe and Happy Holidays..... Lillis
Fiona was a wonderful host - she was very accommodating helpful and nice. The cottage was clean beautifully decorated and very peaceful.
Alyson was very cordial and went above and beyond my expectations.  It's a must stay if you are in the Austin area.  Thanks Alyson!

This place is a beautiful and cozy little home in what might be the most convenient place in all of Austin especially to the Zilker/Barton Springs downtown & S. Congress areas.  Two of us stayed here for a weekend while attending a wedding and just loved the place.  I have every intention of staying here in the future.  Austin vets will appreciate the location and newbies will appreciate the plentiful information that Sovay provides to help enjoy the area - don't think twice about staying here!

The house was as described.  The house was clean and well ordered.  The beds in the bedrooms were very comfortable but the sofa bed needs a sleeping bag on top of it for extra padding.

The rental access and exit were also as described and easy.  The homeowner allowed us extra time to check out on the last day which was a nice accommodation and she was very responsive and pleasant.

Also excellent was the speed with which we received our damage deposit back.

We would rent this house again.

Beautiful space impeccably clean and had everything we needed. Neighborhood was very safe and quiet and neighbors were friendly. Kelly was a gracious host and made us feel very comfortable. Nice touches were fresh flowers Greek yogurt and fresh fruit. Great stay!

I stayed at Sylvia's place for a month while I did a visiting rotation at the hospital.  She helped me find great places to eat and things to do during my limited free time.  The place was perfect for what I needed and the bed was comfortable. Loved the easy access to the lake trail a few blocks away.   I was also glad to use one of the bikes nearly every day to commute.  Thanks for a great experience!  ~LAP
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: A quiet and peaceful retreat with sleek modern design the birdhouse was the perfect intro to Austin.  Dolina and her husband were great hosts too - she saved me a gnarly hour-long drive through rush hour traffic by recommending something better and closer by. I highly recommend a stay  at the cosy casita!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: Great place great hosts highly recommended.

Wonderful experience. Angele was friendly communicative and kind. Her place was exactly as advertised. It was beautiful clean and convenient. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3-night stay and would definitely recommend the space to anyone.

Sovay made it incredibly easy to access her bungalow and what a joy it was! Everything was well appointed and clean. After traveling for over 12 hours I needed a nap - the bed is quite possibly the most comfortable I've ever been in! There was a host of amenities offered in the bathroom and the kitchen. I could not have been more pleased with my "home away from home" as I spent my weekend exploring Austin.

This place is the perfect yogi-chiller studio.
Couldn't imagine a nicer place or a nicer location in Austin.
Walls filled with books on India Flatscreen with DVD player/CD player and speakers nice new appliances and nice shower-head.

My highest of recommendations!
Very nice little house that is beautifully maintained and stocked with a marvelous library of interesting books.
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments:
Cool pad! 
Lois has a really nice place and was gracious & helpful.  Great location quiet neighborhood and visually entertaining.

Elizabeth and David were great hosts!  We stayed at their place for two weeks while  searching for an apartment in Austin. They were very kind easy going and a lot of fun as well!  I would definitely recommend staying here. I really appreciated that they were willing to work with us staying a few days longer then planned in order for us to move into our new apartment. ****(Also the bed was really comfy too!).

The cottage was clean comfortable well appointed and has its own separate entrance. It is located on a nice quiet and safe streetƒ??which is within walking distance to one of the most trendy areas in Austin. Sovay was an excellent host that went above and beyond to ensure a great experience. She made me feel very welcome in her home and was always available for questions concerns or even just a chat. Highly recommended!
Lois was great and her place is as promised fun funky and peaceful. Very close to everything. Unique and artistic. We loved it.

My sister and I had an absolutely wonderful stay at your bungalow.  It is in a perfect location.  

It is beautifully simple spotless happy quiet.  I hope to stay there often.

Loved airbnb I've never used it before. Andy and Ellen were
wonderful and the location plus cottage was perfect for our needs. Would highly recommend.

I had to find a place to stay at the last minute and Lester was really responsive and helpful from the time I sent the first message until he ran out of the house as I was leaving to keep me from forgetting something. His house is exactly like the pictures - old and small but nice and very comfortable. It's also in one of my favorite areas of Austin South Congress and there are a lot of things you can walk to and it's not hard to catch a cab if you want to go somewhere else.

I was in town for a wedding and didn't have much spare time but Lester had all kinds of fun things going on that I wish I could have taken advantage of. His recommendations were excellent - I haven't met a more connected and knowledgeable Austin local.

Lester is a great host! I couldn't have asked for more.
listing_name: SOCO One private room in a 2B house

comments: We stayed at Belle's guest house for 3 nights and it was such a wonderful experience. The guest house was in excellent condition very earthy yet comfy. I love the smell of wood in the house from the beautiful woods that were used to build up the entire house. Belle and her husband were very nice couple they showed us the nice local&natural restaurants and it was delicious. She even made us some blueberry muffins and offered to drive us to the bus station on the day we check out. Definitely recommend this place. Such a sweet stop in Austin!

I have to warn potential customers about a slight problem I had with Sylvia. On arrival she asked for a $100 deposit (which is normal of course) in cash or check form. She wrote a receipt and said we would get it back on departure. 

The morning came where we had to go. She overslept even though we had discussed a 9 AM departure. She then said "Oh right you know what... I spent your cash so I'll send it to you in the mail"... We found this totally irresponsible and unprofessional.

She ended up writing us a check on the spot and it did not bounce. The point is she was not a responsible host. A respectful guest shouldn't have to think about whether he/she is going to get their deposit back.

I would consider looking in to other hosts on Air BNB in Austin.
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: Great hosts and a beautiful place. The pictures don't do it justice. Also very close to UT and a bunch of cool coffee shops and restaurants. Since I was staying for a longer period Kevin even let me use his bike! If this seems like the type of place that appeals to you well you won't be disappointed.

We stayed at Merri's house for a week.  It was even cooler in person than we thought.  Definitely a "wow" house.  We loved that everything down to the games in the drawers (1960's Ouija board) was in keeping with the period.  The vintage stereo with speakers wired into the bathroom is a big plus and makes the place very vibey.

We were a tad bit skeptical when we saw they live in the back and have a dog as we wanted privacy and quiet.  This was not an issue AT ALL.  We never even noticed they were there as you cant see where they live at all and we never heard their dog bark once.  We met them when we first arrived they were very laid back and their dog was beyond sweet with us and our 2 children.

The neighbourhood is very cute and close to everything - less than 5 mins to South Congress and close to the East side.  Lovely parks nearby for the children to play.

Overall they were very attentive hosts when we needed them and the house was clean comfortable and cozy. We would love to make this the place we stay every time we come to Austin.  Definitely recommend!

Beautiful place great location.  Heather is a great host and left her condo fully stocked for us and was easy to communicate with.  Upscale kitchen and the bed is very comfortable.  We will definitely look forward to staying there again.   Thank you!   Max & Phillipe
listing_name: Chic Cozy Condo near Zilker Park

comments: The Private Suite in Zilker was a great place to stay. It was very comfortable and Sovay was a great host. She went the extra mile to provide a good stay.

My boyfriend and I had a fantastic stay in this apartment.  The space was clean and inviting and you can tell that Kelly takes good care of the the apartment.  The neighborhood was very quiet but still very convenient for getting around the city.  I would absolutely stay here again if my travels take me back to Austin.

We have officially found our getaway bungalow in Austin! It was the perfect home away from home after driving all the way from San Francisco. Not only was it spotless and adorable but also very cozy ( and pet friendly!). The location was a mere minutes from our family and even closer to our new favorite vegan eatery. We will definitely recommend this gem to all our friends and family passing through Austin. Thanks Sovay for being a great hostess.

From the moment I opened the door of this sweet house I fell in LOVE! So much light adorable design great conscious green choices like solar hot water split AC/heaters bio-clean detergent etc. Loved cooking on the gas stove. This place is so conveniently located in the groovy heart of 78704... couldn't ask for a better location. Could easily walk to adorable shops great tacos & more and 24 hour pharmacy. Hop skip and jump from three great markets... Whole Foods in one direction Central Market & Sprouts in the other. Close to Barton Springs Zilker Park great music venues. Quiet neighborhood. The owner Earlynn was especially helpful and quite frankly the sweetest person I have ever dealt with in handling my inquiry and questions. Will most certainly seek ou this delightful home on my next visit! Thanks for the hookup AirB&B!

My friend and I needed a centrally located place to stay while interviewing all over the Austin area. Sylvia's place was perfect! Really close drive to all the great restaurants and bars. We got to love on the doggies and we were able to come and go as needed. I definitely recommend staying during the holidays because Sylvia makes amazing fudge treats! Thanks again Sylvia!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: In all my traveling never have I come across somewhere as beautiful as Belle's guest house. My partner and I were blown away at how amazing and cosy it is & wished we could keep the guest house as our own home. Belle and her family did everything they could to make us feel welcome and were very helpful and genuine great people. If we ever return to Austin there is no other place we'd stay but here.

We stayed at Kellyƒ??s apartment for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. The apartment is conveniently located very clean and comfortable. Kelly and Louie are great hosts. This apartment will be our preferred choice to stay during future Austin visits.
This was the perfect place for us ƒ?? all the comforts of home great location very friendly hosts pleasant grounds and spectacular sunrises to start the day.
listing_name: Waterfront Condo on Lady Bird Lake

comments:
Hosts were welcoming and courteous. Cozy older cottage with three distinct spaces (living/bedroom kitchen bathroom) ideal for medium to long stays. The fridge stocked with organic breakfast items was a great bonus. Parking in the driveway right next to the cottage entrance. Location excellent on a quiet street close to the university.

Heating unit was a bit noisy... had to turn off at night. Not a problem as the cottage was well equipped with extra blankets and stayed pretty warm even without the unit on. 

I would certainly stay here again. Thanks to Andy and Ellen for the warm welcome.
The studio was great! Really nice and clean and full of little details that make the difference. We had a great time!
listing_name: Walk to 6th St and Convention Ctr

comments: This place was perfect for what we needed. Dolina has done an amazing job with the design and layout of the space. Very cozy and comfortable. Thanks again for your hospitality!
listing_name: Cozy Casita Near Downtown in SoCo

comments: This place was amazing!!  Beautiful CLEAN comfortable (luxurious even) GREAT location.  Pete has thought of everything in terms of furnishings and amenities.  Totally professional through and through!  Would HIGHLY recommend to everyone!!
Our family loved the outdoor shower--and the chickens!  This was perfectly suited to our needs.

Sovay's house is located ideally to alot of venues in Austin from movie theathers ( Alamo) to downtown. I truly enjoyed the privacy Sovay gave me the time I soent in her wonderful home. I would recommend her house to any one that wants privacy enjoy all that Austin has to offer.

I spent a lovely Christmas Holiday at Sovay's and found the experience quite lovely.  The cottage was immaculate and filled with special homey touches.  Salon Kitty put a special smile on my face.  I will return to her lovely home in South Austin.

My wife and I stayed with Marcus over Christmas and really enjoyed our home away from home.  Marcus was very welcoming upon our arrival and made sure during our stay that we were well cared for while still allowing us our privacy.  The "Burrow" was a very comfortable digs for us and was great to come back to after a day out and about with family in Austin.  We will likely stay again on future visits.

This house is great.  Immaculate attractively furnished and in a good location.  The backyard is large and pleasant.  I had my toddler granddaughter here with me for several days and it was perfect for her too.  I heartily recommend it.

Cute house in great location.  Perfect for a family with young kids -- there was a crib and a single bed available in addition to lots of great toys and kid books.  Katherine was very responsive to our needs.

OMG!! How lucky we were to find Belle's guest home on airbnb!!
Me Tony and our little dog hurricane had the most unexpected experience with Belle & family. The guest house was very clean and neat and even tho we arrive late at night Belle was there to great us with delicious homemade Christmas cookies. Hurricane and Martha ( Belle's dog) became friends instantly. 
After settling in Belle's place became very comfortable and home feeling:-). The neighborhood was very quiet and we felt very safe when out walking hurricane.

Belle paid attention to any of our needs with a surprise on Christmas morning with homemade pastries.!
There is so many good things to say we can go on forever...
Belle's place is A MUST STAY when visiting Austin tx.

Thanks Belle and family for a great time!!!


Tony Kevin & Hurricane
The apartment was great super comfortable clean and with a great backyard. Simplicity that more than surpassed our needs at a great price. Thanks Kelly we'll likely be back in the spring!

Our time with Melissa and Bill was perfect. They are such generous warm and genuine people. We arrived there on Christmas Eve and were there through out the x - mas season in which they provided for us the sense of family that we  were missing back at home! Greeted with hugs and even food and wine we were stoked!...and then the space in cupids bluff is just beautiful situated up high against a well maintained garded and terrain the bluff has everything you need. Bill and Melissa take great care if this space and it truly becomes a place to just chill out....to take in the clean air and the natural surroundings. first off if you want friendly earthy and artistic to the hilt lois and her home are up at the top of the list.  lois is very engaging and has GREAT recommendations as to where to go - to eat to stroll to hear music - you name it she knows the who and where of austin and especially its creative and funky side.

her home is in a sweet quiet neighborhood parking is easy - right out front - and plentiful and the room we stayed in was in the back so it's private as can be.  there are plenty of pillows for the futon and soaps and towels for the bath so that's comforting.  the room is clean bright colorful and charming and charm is often what i look for in b&b's so that's why lois' place caught my eye to begin with.

so now for the not-so-good part.  my husband and i are middle aged - i'm 49 and he's 59 - and while we're in pretty good shape overall (we came from d.c. for a tennis clinic weekend outside san antonio (which turned out to be brutal but fun!) but we wanted to see austin first.  my husband has a hopefully temporary ankle problem that makes it a little more challenging to deal with futons on the floor.  the futon-only aspect wasn't what i had expected and couldn't see it was that from the photos when i first checked out the listing.

the futon needed to be pulled out and a top sheet put on it by us (i didn't find that top sheet until the next morning when i had a look around).  there was no bed table or bedside lamp so there was no way to read in bed without the overhead light on.  the building that is this one-room retreat space is not actually designed to be a bedroom; the ceiling is very high so the lights are way up overhead and so heat rises too and if it's chilly as it was the night we were there you need to put both the heaters on - i'm grateful they were in the room.  and there were plenty of blankets too so that helped.

quite frankly the bathroom was uncomfortable as it is very small.  the sink faucet is a goose-neck so high above the bowl that water splashes everywhere when you turn it on with any force.  the shower is very narrow so if i was much bigger than my petite 5' self i don't think i'd enjoy it much.

the reason i mention all this is a) it's good to know if you're older and this is not what you're looking for b) the way the room and bathroom are set up is not likely to change so there's no reason to just mention it privately to lois and last but not least c) because of the price.  at $80/night i felt this was kind of pricey for what we were getting.  first of all airbnb is a strange name for listings that don't offer breakfasts and in this case there was a futon mattress (no frame) on the floor instead of a bed so my husband called it a bed and breakfast without the bed or the breakfast.  i went back to airbnb and checked out some other b&b listings in the general vicinity of lois' and found that for the same price a more standard and frankly higher quality of furnishings and services were offered.  sometimes charm doesn't make up for the basics and i guess that's especially true for many of us as we age.

so the bottom line is that while lois is a sweetheart and a total gem of a resource for how to experience austin's progressive and 'weirder' side the room would be much more adequately priced at half the cost and we would have been quite happy with exactly what we were paying for if that were the case.
